As he is already experienced in this business and is well known among the villagers, Ramaz will have a good numbers of clients. He will not depend on a salary anymore and work hard to earn good income for the family. The increased income will help him to provide better living conditions for his aged parents.

loans.use: to purchase all the needed materials to open his own furniture workshop

loans.name: Henrietta

texts.en:
Henrietta is 59 years old and married with six children. She lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over nine years and earns 45,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) every month. 

She has been in GDMPC since the year 2009, and now she has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more items to sell (Goods, snacks, Drinks)

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is 35 years old, married with 2 children. She lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting rice for sale in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 5 years and earns 25,000 PHP every month. Jocelyn has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Majdoleen

texts.en: Majdoleen is a 39-year-old lady who has four children. She works in a clothes tailoring workshop. She also sells clothing items at home to make additional income. Now Majdoleen is applying for a loan to increase the quantity of clothes she has, by adding different types of women's clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothing items to sell

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa is a 55-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Ubay, Bohol. She is engaged in a food-vending business selling home-cooked snack foods to the people in her place. Marissa is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for food-vending like flour, sugar, butter, margarine and cooking oil. With this, she will be able to cook more and sell more to the people in her place. In the future, Marissa hopes of making her business sustainable and a success.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food vending like flour, sugar, butter, margarine and cooking oil

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has lived in Viwandani, an informal settlement in Nairobi, Kenya, for the past twelve years. The father of two is a shrewd businessman who is able to analyse the market conditions and viability of any products and services that he decides to offer his customers. He has built and sustained businesses such as video shows, barber shops and farming.
From his judgement, Fresh Life toilets are affordable to area residents, and the absence of a sanitation facility in the vicinity makes his choice very strategic. He will therefore be able to provide residents in his area with sanitation while making a profit. 
He hopes that the Fresh Life toilets will be as successful as he has calculated and that he will expand the benefits of better sanitation to other parts of the informal settlement.
John dreams big and wants to own a company as well as be a front liner in community sanitation initiatives. As a family man, he wants to be able to sustain his family as long as he lives.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es: El señor Jhonny nació en la ciudad de La Paz, viene de una familia dedicada a la confección y comercialización de artículos  de vestir, es una persona joven y emprendedora, desde sus 23 años comenzó con esta actividad de la confección y comercialización de ropa deportiva, empezó con pocas maquinas y en algunas ocasiones sus padres le prestaban las maquinas para elaborar la ropa. El señor Jhonny se especializo en la elaboración de ropa deportiva, ya que al ser una persona joven, tenía conocimiento de las preferencias y moda actual.  Por la calidad  de la elaboración de los productos y servicio del señor Jhonny, se ha consolidado en el mercado, logrando incrementar su producción con el transcurso de los años. El señor Jhonny tiene la visión de armar una pequeña empresa de elaboración de ropa deportiva, para así poder exportar a otros departamentos del país; el crédito que solicita el cliente es para la compra de mercadería de telas para así incrementar su producción.
texts.en:
Jhonny was born in the city of La Paz, and comes from a family who produce and sell clothing. He is an enterprising young man and started his own business at 23 years old, making and selling sportswear. He began without much equipment, however his parents sometimes lent him their machines so that he could make clothes. 

Jhonny has focused on sportswear production because, as a young person, he is aware of his customers' preferences and fashion. As a result of the high quality garments and service that he provides, he has established himself in the market and his production has increased over time. Johnny's vision is to build a small sportswear company to enable his products to be exported to other areas of the country. 

The loan that Jhonny is requesting will be invested in purchasing fabrics and materials in order to increase production.

loans.use: to purchase materials and fabrics

loans.name: Roberta

texts.es: La señora Roberta proviene de una familia humilde, trabajadora y responsable; está casada aproximadamente veinte años, tiene cinco hijos, se casó muy joven. La señora Roberta se dedica a la actividad de agropecuaria (crianza de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche y actividades de producción de maíz), esta actividad lo realiza desde que era muy joven, la señora Roberta transforma la leche cruda que produce sus vacas en quesillos y lo va a vender en los principales mercados de su zona. Cuando la señora Roberta comercializa sus quesillos, estos se terminan rápido ya que la señora ofrece quesillos de buena calidad. Trabajando duro y con esfuerzo la señora Roberta y su esposo se  compraron un lote donde puedan vivir y expandir las actividades que realizan. Actualmente la señora Roberta está solicitando el crédito para la compra de una vaca, ya que con esto podrá incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Roberta comes from a humble family and is a hardworking, responsible lady. She was married at a young age, has been married for 20 years and has five children. Roberta works in agriculture, producing corn and raising cattle for milk. She has been doing this work since she was very young. 

Roberta makes cheese from raw milk produced by her cows, and sells her products in major markets in her neighborhood. Roberta's cheeses always sell quickly due to their high quality. Through much hard work and effort, Roberta and her husband purchased some land where they can live and expand their business. Roberta is requesting this loan to buy a dairy cow, which will help her to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Hadeel

texts.en: Hadeel is an 18-year-old married lady. She has two kids. Her husband works in a restaurant to support his family while she sells blankets at home to friends and neighbors. Now Hadeel is applying for a youth loan to get a new collection of bed covers that are suitable for the summer season.

loans.use: to get a new collection of bed covers

loans.name: Yanto

texts.en: Yanto runs small stall, which sells staple goods, clothes, mobile phone airtime credits, and he also processes bill payments for the customers. Yanto is an entrepreneur with four people living in his house including his 10-year-old son and a 7-year-old daughter. He joined Ruma in December 2012 because he wanted to increase his income and feels really excited to expand his business on selling mobile phone airtime credits and doing bill payments for the customers. For the last three months, he has around $20 /day sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, he needs a loan for more working capital in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie, 41 years-old is a [a simple mother and wife]. For the last five years, she has been engaged in a transportation business in order to sustain the needs of her family. She is asking for a loan of Php 12,000 in order to buy spare parts and gasoline for her business. She hope that someday she can renovate their house to have a good living condition.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and gasoline for her business.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en: Rolando is a 41-year-old, simple farmer from the village of Cansan province, Cabagan.  Rolando is engaged in farming for eight years.  To make a living, he needs to do more effort to address the needs of his family.  He is requesting a loan of 22,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for farming.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is a farmer. Since 2008, he has been engaged in growing crops like rice.
To manage the farm he is helped by his wife. He started his farming with the planting of corn in an open field. Jimmy decided to buy rice seeds for the expansion of cultivated areas and a drip irrigation system for watering.
His future plans are to get attachments for a tractor. His personal plans are to finish building a home.
He needs help to fund the tomato seeds and drip irrigation system, to further develop his farm.

loans.use: to buy tomato seeds and a drip irrigation system to water them.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is 29 years old; he is a farmer and is single. Rice farming allows him to gain about 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming. He wanted to increase his crop production; that is why he is now asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to sustain his crops with fertilizers and insecticides. He will buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.

In the future, Jimmy would like to keep improving his crop production and harvest crops abundantly to attain success in life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Ariungerel

texts.en:
Mrs. Ariungerel is 40 years old and lives with her three children in Kherlen, an eastern town of Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on fenced land. 

Her eldest child studied mechanical engineering at university and now stays at home, looking for job. Her second child studies at university and the other one stays at home. 

She herself has been running an aquarium shop for two years and has attracted numerous customers to her business. She is requesting a loan of 2400000 MNT to purchase fish, feed, aquariums and filters for a new branch. 

After opening her second aquarium shop, she can generate more income for her family and invest in her children's education. The borrower is a very hard-working individual, who is now carrying the entire family on her shoulders.

loans.use: to open a second aquarium shop

loans.name: Iwan

texts.en: Iwan runs a small stall where he sells cell phone accessories and he also processes mobile phone airtime credits. Iwan is an entrepreneur with three persons living in his house. He joined Ruma eight months ago because he wanted to expand and add another business opportunity to selling mobile phone airtime credits. He still feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments for the customers. For the last three months, he has around $20 - 30/day sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business runs, he needs more working capital to be able to do transaction on weekends.

loans.use: To obtain working capital to process mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
This is Lucia. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the needed spare parts and accessories of her computers. The loan was also a big help for their family in terms of finances. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs. She is also a jeepney operator while her husband is the driver. They are more focused now on their jeepney operation but they still have their computer shop.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and pay for the maintenance of their jeepney unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and pay the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lucia hopes to be ale to have more jeepneys and dreams to have a better life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 
 
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts, accessories, and maintenance of her jeepney.

loans.name: Fadil

texts.en:
Fadil runs a small stall which sells snacks, drinks, and mobile phone airtime credits. 

Together with his wife, who is a housewife, he works as a shopkeeper and has four people living in his house. He joined Ruma nine months ago because he wanted to have additional income, and still feels really excited to expand his business of selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments for the customers. 

For the last three months, he has had around $90/day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). As the business continues, he needs a loan for more working capital in order to be able to do transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.en:
This is Gilberto, 21, resident of Taguig, Philippines. He is still single and lives with his parents. He helps them in managing their household as he operates the business. At this time, he is working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gilberto operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines, and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories and others of the like. Gilberto's regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. He will be incorporating the loan into his current revolving fund used to buy trash from collectors. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.

Gilberto dreams that his business will be more successful and hopes that his whole family will have good health. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in his business.

loans.name: Erick Maina

texts.en:
Erick is a long time resident of Mukuru kwa Ruben's informal settlement in Nairobi, Kenya. The father of six is also a business man, who has tried his hand and succeeded as a bar operator and a land lord.

He first saw a Fresh Life toilet at a local pub and got interested in acquiring one because his neighbourhood did not have accessible sanitation which led people to use unhygienic means to dispose of their waste. 

A fresh life toilet will be a relief to the neighbourhood because it will provide much needed accessible, hygienic and affordable sanitation to area residents, which will in turn make life and the environment safer.

Erick's hopes to add to his rental properties, acquire land and educate his children as well as help them start their own business ventures.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a businessman in Mukuru kwa Ruben, an informal settlement in Nairobi, Kenya. 

His business interests in the informal settlement include water points that provide residents with safe drinking water and rental houses. Although he does not currently live in the community, the father of three was able to move himself out of the informal settlement by seizing business opportunities that presented themselves.

He first saw the Fresh Life toilet at a local pub and learned more about it from a pitch done to church members. He believes the toilets will provide residents with accessible sanitation and a cleaner environment.

He hopes to add more Fresh Life toilets to the community and be part of the solution to the sanitation challenges facing area residents.

His life long dream is to build a decent house for himself and educate his children to the highest level possible.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 43-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has three children. The oldest is 23 and the youngest is 17 years old. 

She is engaged in the farming business. She grows rice and has been in this business for 23 years now together with her husband. Usually, she earns 3,000 PHP in a month. This is the source of her income.

Maria is requesting for a loan to buy fertilizer. This will be used to make her rice to grow faster. With the help of this loan, she can now provide fertilizer for her rice to create a better harvest.

In the future, Maria hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es: La señora Felicidad tiene 38 años de edad, actualmente no tiene conyugue, tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella, uno de sus hijos le ayuda en las actividades agropecuarias que realiza y su otro hijo se encuentra estudiando en la escuela de la Comunidad San Miguel del Bañado. Actualmente se dedica a la siembra de maíz, cría y venta ganado bovino y también produce ají colorado. El diario vivir de Felicidad es muy sacrificado y agotador ya que son varias actividades que tiene que atender.  Los ingresos que obtiene no son suficientes para cubrir los gastos de la alimentación de su familia, por ese motivo ella tomo la decisión de solicitar un crédito para  comprar agroquímicos, y de esta manera la señora Felicidad podrá aumentar sus ingresos, además la señora Felicidad podrá mejorar su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Felicidad is 38 years old. Currently, she is not married. She has two children who depend on her. One of her children helps her with the agricultural work she performs and her other child studies at school in the community of San Miguel del Bañado. Currently, she is dedicated to planting maize. She breeds and sells cattle and also produces red pepper. Felicidad's daily life is full of sacrifice and is exhausting since there are various activities that she has to attend to. The income she obtains is not sufficient to cover the food expenses of her family. For this reason, she has decided to request a loan to buy agrochemicals and, in this way, Felicidad will be able to expand her income. Additionally, Felicidad will be able to improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agrochemicals.

loans.name: Rolan

texts.en: Rolan is 26 years old and married with  children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a retail business buying and selling to earn a living. He has been in this business for over 3 years and earns 6,000 PHP every month. He joined GDMPC this year. Rolan has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional products to buy and sell, including yakult and soya milk. His hopes and dreams is to have a better future and improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to buy and sell like yakult and soya milk

loans.name: Merry Ann

texts.en: Merry Ann, 27, is married and has two children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She has managed a gardening business for 5 years, earning a monthly income of about PHP 2,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,500 to purchase additional fertilizer. Merry Ann has been a member of GDMPC since 2009. In the future, she hopes to improve her business so that she can support her children better.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer.

loans.name: Faisal

texts.en:
Faisal is a 42-year-old man who is married and lives with his seven children in Sana`a, Yemen. 

He is a person who is very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic and has a great desire to succeed. He is a teacher on a low salary. Sometimes, he says, the salary didn`t cover his children expenses.  

He owns a house and intends to buy construction supplies, but he doesn't have sufficient money. So he has applied for a loan of 300,000 YER . He hopes to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to use on his house.

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en:
Majeda is a 42-year-old tailor. She has her own sewing machine and works in her own workshop. 

Previously, she applied for a loan that helped her do some maintenance on her tools. Now she is applying for another loan to buy more fabric and threads to increase her productivity.

loans.use: to buy more fabric and threads

loans.name: Mirco Efrain

texts.es: El Sr. Mirco tiene 32 años de edad, es soltero, actualmente trabaja en el  rubro de transporte público como taxista, vive en la casa de su padre conjuntamente con sus hermano. El Sr. Mirco de condición humilde solicita hoy el crédito con el fin de poder refaccionar el motor de su vehículo que con mucho sacrificio pudo comprarlo y de esa forma seguir en el rubro y percibir ingresos que le genera el mismo. Se pudo conocer además que el señor Mirco es una persona trabajadora que desde muy pequeño trabajo para poder sobrellevar su situación económica que atravesaba, por tal razón  solo curso hasta la primaria dejando de lado sus estudios, es así que hoy pide un crédito para poder superarse, ya que el mismo además ayudara a cumplir a futuro el sueño tan esperado que este tiene que es el de poder construir su casa.
texts.en: Mirco is 32 years old and is single. Currently, he works in a public transportation role as a taxi driver. He lives in his father's house along with his brother. Mirco, who is humble, is today requesting a loan with the goal of being able to repair his motor vehicle that he was able to buy with a lot of sacrifice and, in this way, continue with his job and earn the income that it generates. Additionally, know that Mirco is a hard working person who, since he was young, worked to be able to survive his economic situation. For that reason, he finished only elementary school leaving his studies to the side. Today he is requesting a loan to be able to overcome since it will help him achieve his hoped for dream in the future that is to be able to build a house.

loans.use: to repair his motor vehicle.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is 38 years old, and married with four children, two of whom are in school. He is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Jerry has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and a fishing businesses. Jerry is borrowing PHP 35,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. in order to buy spare parts for his tricycle and groceries for his store.

Jerry sustained his business activities through the past eleven loans from NWTF. Jerry hopes that his hard work will help obtain his attain his dream to save enough to buy a new engine for his fishing boat, and continue to send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his tricycle and groceries for his store.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 41 years old. She is married and has four children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Chona is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Chona has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothes.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to help her children finish college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Proeng's Group

texts.en:
Proeng, 54, is married and has nine children. He resides in a rural village located in Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. For the past thirty years, he has been growing maize on two hectares of farmland. He is able to earn about 60,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Proeng’s group is comprised of three members who live in the same village. Proeng has been a member of VisionFund for seven loan cycles. The past loans from VisionFund have helped him to better support his family. Now leading his group to apply for a new loan, Proeng, who is the leader, will use his portion of the loan funds to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland. With this loan, he hopes to increase his maize production, so as to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland

loans.name: Lolito

texts.en:
Lolito is 44 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a copra business in the local community, to earn a living. He has been in this business for over six years and earns 8,000 PHP every month.

He has joined GDMPC this year to gain access to loans for his business. And now he has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP. He will use the loan to purchase additional materials for copra production. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for copra production

loans.name: Mariniel

texts.en:
Mariniel is 34 years old and married with three children. She lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. 

Mariniel owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over five years and earns 10,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC this year and now Mariniel has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, sugar, coffee, soap and shampoo. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, sugar, coffee, soap and shampoo.

loans.name: K. Paul's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of six members: Paul, Eric, Gladys, Victoria, Mary and Paulina. They sell electrical appliances, shoes, second-hand clothes, slippers, chop bar and slippers in the community respectively. They reside in the Dansoman community. They have been together since 2011 and are still doing very well.

Paul is 29 years old. He is married to Mary, a 26-year-old trader. They have two children. He has been with ID Ghana for the past two years and is doing very well. He has been in this business activity for 10 years now. He sells from Mondays to Saturdays. 

This is his fourth loan and he needs an amount of GHS 1,500 to buy more electrical appliances to sell to his customers. He has been able, through his business, to provide himself with a quality education. He is grateful to ID Ghana. 

The entire group needs a total amount of GHS 6,400 to buy more and to sell to their customers in the Dansoman community.

loans.use: To buy more electrical appliances to sell to his customers

loans.name: Zafar Iqbal

texts.en:
Mr Zafar is a 51-year-old milk seller. He is the father of five sons and two daughters. 

Mr Zafar has been in the business of selling milk for the past 35 years. This business is the only source of income for his family. Therefore, he wants to grow his business by purchasing two calves. All of his clients like the delicious milk he sells. 

Mr Zafar has requested a loan of 120,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will help him to increase his net income and savings in the future.

He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase two calves to sell milk.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en: Paz  has earned a living through her hog raising business for almost ten years now.  Paz is a resident of the town of Panglao, Bohol.  Paz needs a loan to buy more feed and food supplements for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her hog raising business, thus augmenting her yield and profit. In the future, Paz hopes to make her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more feed and food supplements for the pigs

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida has been engaged in a hog-raising business for almost ten years now. She lives in the town of Panglao, Bohol. 

Zenaida is asking for a loan to buy feed and food supplements for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her pig-raising business, thus augmenting her profit and income. 

In the future, Zenaida dreams of making her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy feed and food supplements for her pigs.

loans.name: 3.1.266.01.thiệu Phú Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thu works in aluminum furniture making business. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make iron and aluminum goods and sell.

Thu is 39 years old and she is married with 3 children.
Thu is the group leader of the 3.1.266.01.Thiệu Phú  solidarity group, which consists of 8 members. 
Thu supports 3 dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Thu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thu has successfully repaid 1 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Thu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thu hopes to buy land of her own, to maintain  a successful business, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make iron and aluminum goods and sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy animals to sell on for a profit

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Esi did not have access to any form of formal education. Yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. 

Currently, Esi sells general provisions in Emissakrom  (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about five years. She is married to a mechanic and together they have four children. 

Esi uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Esi will use the loan to purchase more provisions, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. 

Esi wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions, which will aid her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: El señor Vicente convive más de 7 años con la señora Roberta, ambos con una instrucción de nivel primario, tienen 2 hijos dependientes que están estudiando en nivel primario. Viven en la comunidad de 2do Aguirre hacia el sud de Colomi.El esposo se dedica a la actividad de constructor albañil dentro de la población misma y  en la población de Sacaba, a la vez son agricultores; marido y mujer cultivan papa, haba y oca; cuentan con cabezas de ganado vacuno (1 lechera, 3 de engorde, 1 vaquilla y 1 ternero). El señor Vicente solicita un préstamo para refacción de construcción de su vivienda ya que desea realizar el cambio de todo el techo de su vivienda. El señor Vicente indica que con el crédito tendrá mejores condiciones de vida hacia el futuro y de esta manera podrá vivir más cómodo.
texts.en:
Sr. Vicente has lived for more than seven years with Sra. Roberta. Both have primary education. They have two dependent children who are in primary school. They live in the community of 2nd Aguirre towards the south of Colomi. 

Vicente works in construction as a bricklayer in the Sacaba neighbourhood. He and his wife are also farmers growing potatoes, beans, and oca. They have cattle too (one milk cow, three being fattened, a heifer, and a calf). Vicente is seeking a loan to repair his house as he wishes to change the roof. He notes that with the loan his future living conditions will be improved and he will be able to live more comfortably.

loans.use: Repair his house

loans.name: Alejandra Daniela

texts.es: La señorita Alejandra Daniela, es una persona de 19 años de edad,  de estado civil soltera, alcanzo a estudiar el bachillerato en humanidades, por motivos de trabajo vive en un domicilio alquilado y cuenta con un dependiente económico a cargo el cual es su pequeño hijo. La actividad económica principal de Alejandra es prestar el servicio de secretaria en la ciudad de Cochabamba en el Sindicato Mixto de Autotransporte "15 de Octubre" de la provincia Tíraque; asimismo aprovecha su tiempo libre para realizar la venta de productos cosméticos y perfumes, con el cual genera ingresos económicos adicionales. Y finalmente la señorita Alejandra tiene ganas de seguir superándose y para tal efecto se ve en la necesidad de solicitar capital de operación para realizar la implementación de una pequeña librería en la población de Tíraque que a futuro le permitirá obtener ingresos económicos adicionales.
texts.en:
Alejandra Daniela is 19 years old and single. She reached the end of high school studying the humanities. She lives in a rented home because of her work, and has one economic dependent under her care, her young son.

Alejandra's main economic activity is working as a secretary in the city of Cochabamba for the "15th of October" Transport Labour Union of the province of Tíraque. In her spare time she also sells cosmetics and perfume, which allows her to generate more income. Finally, Alejandra wants to continue to push herself, so she is looking to get working capital to open a small bookstore in the town of Tíraque. In the future this will allow her to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy materials for a bookstore.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela, de 43 años de edad , esta casada y tiene una niña de 07 años de edad,  por quien trabaja para brindarle lo mejor, tiene una casa propia en donde vive junto a su parea y su niña.El trabajo de Graciela consiste en el corte y confección de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños, contando con su propia maquina de coser, realiza su propia creación y también refacciona las prendas de sus clientes que van con seguridad que les harán un buen trabajo. Lleva más de  07 años en éste trabajo y tiene un taller muy rustico y pequeño en su casa, trabaja sola y ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar .
Considera rentable su negocio por la demanda que tienen sus servicios y las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta su trabajo pues está en su hogar y puede realizar una actividad que la mantiene ocupada y le permite sentirse una persona productiva, además le permite tener ingresos y cumplir la función de ama de casa y madre .Este es el préstamo número 06  con Kiva y está muy agradecida con su apoyo financiero.Con el monto solicitado de S/.1500 soles, comprará materiales de costura como  tela, algodón, hilos y productos para su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Graciela is 43  years old. She is married and has a 7 year old daughter, for whom she works to give her the best. She has a house where she lives with her spouse and her daughter. Graciela's work consists of sewing clothes for women, men and children. She has her own sewing machine and creates her own clothing. She also repairs her customer's clothing who go to her knowing she will do a good job. She has been doing this work for more than 7 years and she has a very rustic workshop in her house. She works alone and helps her husband with the household expenses. 

She considers her business to be profitable because of the demand for her services and the good earnings that it brings her. She likes her work because it is in her home and it keeps her busy and she feels like a productive person. She also likes to have income and perform the duties of a housewife and mother. This is loan number 06 with Kiva and she is very grateful for the financial support. With the amount she has asked for, S/.1500 soles, she will buy sewing materials such as fabric, cotton and other products for her small business.

loans.use: to buy materials such as fabric, thread, needles, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a freezer for the sale of snow-cones.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 34 años de edad, es soltero, vive en Taulabe,Comayagua.
Oscar desde muy pequeño se ha dedicado a la agricultura, y hace aproximadamente 10 años se dedica al cultivo de cafe, esta actividad es la unica fuente de ingreso en su hogar. Ha solicitado varios creditos con Odef con los que ha podido mejorar su nivel productivo. Actualmente esta solicitando uno por 5000 lempiras para comprar fertilizante , siembra y limpieza de de la finca. Su plan es con la inversion va aumentar el nivel productivo y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar is 34 years old. He is single and lives in Taulabe,Comayagua.

Since Oscar was very small he has worked in agriculture. For about 10 years he has grown coffee and this activity is the only source of income for his home. He has asked for several loans from Odef and with them he has been able to improve his production level. Right now, he is asking for 5000 lempiras to buy fertilizer, to plant and to clear the farm. His plan for the investment is to increase the production level and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, and to pay for planting and clearing the coffee farm to maintain the crop.

loans.name: Angie Lizeth

texts.es:
Ella es Lizeth tiene 18 años, es estudiante de Diseño  gráfico Publicitario en y por las noches estudia Diseño Industrial en otra fundación.
Vive con sus padres, es la mayor de cuatro hijos y pagan arriendo, le ha sido difícil ayudarles a sus padres económicamente hablando ya que estudia de día y de noche, y ellos son los que financian sus estudios, su meta es graduarse este año en la corporación las Mercedes y seguir su carrera como profesional aprovechando el convenio para esto. Pero eso no quiere decir que vaya a dejar su carrera en la jornada de la noche ya que las ve como complementos y eso es lo que busca para desarrollarse como profesional.
Otro de sus anhelos es estudiar Ingles los sabidos el próximo año. Se ve graduarse pronto como profesional en las dos carreras y así aportar conocimiento a la sociedad, como no trabaja actualmente se siente un poco mal al no poder ayudar a sus padres pero espera brindarles muchas cosas maravillosas en un futuro.
En sus ratos libres se dedica a jugar fútbol  o a leer un buen libro, cocina o dibuja, le gusta mucho innovar, la publicidad el dibujo, utilizar el computador, crear, imaginar cosas y estudiar; en un futuro será profesional, su conocimiento lo aportara a la sociedad y espera que en algún momento haya un mundo mejor.
texts.en:
Lizeth is 18 years old and is a student of graphic design for advertising. At night she studies industrial design at another school. She lives with her parents, and she is the oldest of four children. They pay rent, and it has been difficult to help her parents economically because she goes to school both day and night. Her parents pay for her studies. Her goal is to graduate from the "Las Mercedes" institute of higher learning this year and to continue her degree as a professional, taking advantage of the agreement for this. But this doesn't mean that she will leave her night studies since she sees the two degrees as complementary, and this is what she is looking for in terms of professional development.

Another one of her goals is to study English on Saturdays next year. She will graduate very soon as a professional from her two degrees and bring her knowledge into society. Since she isn't working right now she feels a bit bad that she can't help her parents, but she hopes to offer them many wonderful things in the future.

In her free time, she likes to play football, read a good book, cook, or draw. She likes to invent things, and she likes advertising, drawing, using the computer, being creative, imagining things and studying. In the future she will be a professional. Her knowledge will bring her into society and she hopes that at some point the world will be better.

loans.use: to finish her studies in graphic design for advertising.

loans.name: Adali

texts.es:
Adali tiene 37 años de edad, es casado, tiene 5 hijos, vive en el municipio de Taulabe, Comayagua.
Adali se dedica a la agricultura de cafe y granos basicos, el desde hace 10 años se dedica a cultivar la tierra, ya que este ha sido su patrimonio familiar, el vende sus cultivos por temporada. estos productos los comercializa en el mercado local a buen precio. Esta muy contento con las utilidades que le generan. Actualmente esta solicitando un prestamo a Odef de 6000 lempiras para comprar fertilizante para darle la asistencia necesaria a sus cultivos y poder sacar una buena cosecha para la venta. Su meta es seguir invirtiendo en el mantenimiento de sus cultivos para asi obtener una mejor rentabilidad en sus cosechas.
texts.en:
Adali, 37, is married, has five children, and lives in the town of Taulabe, Comayagua.

Adali is a farmer and grows coffee and basic grains.  For ten years he has been farming the land, as this is what he inherited from his family.  He sells the crops depending on the season at the local market for a good price and is happy about the profits he is able to make.

He is currently requesting a loan through ODEF for 6,000 HNL to buy fertilizer so he can give his crops the necessary care and obtain a good harvest to sell.  His goal is to continue investing in crop maintenance to improve crop profitability.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for better crop treatment.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 28-year-old from Ubay, Bohol. She has an 8-year-old daughter. She has been engaged in the farming business for five years. She grows rice in this area. This is the source of her income. She earns 3000 PHP monthly.

Marites is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer. This is used to make rice to grow fast. With the help of this loan, she can provide fertilizer for her rice to make it grow fast.

In the future, Marites hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Carmen Delfina

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 20 años de edad es soltera tiene un hijo, vive con los padre y el hijo en la ciudad de Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

Es Integrante de la VRC ALLY ÑAN está conformada por 10 socios que son de la misma comunidad, esta ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina.

Carmen tiene una tienda pequeña donde vende víveres. Se  dedica a la agricultura a la siembras de papas, maíz, lechuga. Además se dedica a la crianza de pollos, ganado.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, insecticidas, herbicidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras.
El sueño es tener una casa propia y mejorar en el estudio.  Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasar tiempo con el hijo.
texts.en:
Carmen, 20, is single and has a son.  She lives with her parents and son in the city of Guaranda in the province of Bolívar.

She is a member of the communal bank ALLY ÑAN, which is comprised of ten members from the same community, about 20 minutes from the office.

Carmen has a small grocery store and also grows potatoes, corn, and lettuce.  She also raises chicken and cattle.  

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, urea, insecticides and herbicides.  With the help of the loan she will be able to buy what she needs for planting.  Her goal is to have her own house one day and improve her education.  The challenge she is up against is the competition.  She enjoys spending her free time with her son.

loans.use: To buy seeds, urea, insecticides and herbicides.

loans.name: Rosetta

texts.en:
Rosetta is 40 years old and lives in West Point, a very crowded community that is well-known in Montserrado County. She is living together with her husband and four children at home. The ages of the children range from 8 years to 16 years old and they are going to school. Her husband is a civil servant of the Liberian government. Moreover, her business has being ongoing for the past 16 years with better improvement. 

Rosetta started the business with earnings from her spouse's salary. She sells cooked food and has not encountered any problem since she began the business. She is requesting a loan to improve her business by buying more stock and building a bigger food center for the future.

loans.use: to improve her business by buying more stock and building a bigger food center for the future.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 41 years old, single, and has two children. She manages a variety store in the market. Agnes is selling blouses, bags and accessories for cellular phones. Agnes is happy that her business has continued to operate up to the present.

Agnes' goal in life is growing her business so she will have her own stall and will no longer have to rent a stall for her business. Agnes plans to take out a loan of P40,000 to buy belts, bags and hats to sell to her customers. She is doing her best to thrive with the business she has right now.

loans.use: to buy belts, bags and hats to sell to her customers.

loans.name: M. Afzal

texts.en: Mr. Afzal lives in Lahore, Pakistan. He is a responsible father  of eight  children. He has been running a general store in the area which is the only source of income for his family. Presently he is interested in purchasing a variety of products for the store, including biscuits, bread, sweets, eggs, jam, etc. to sell. For that reason, he has requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will help him to increase his net income and savings in the future. He is thankful that the loan will be a productive one for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products to sell.

loans.name: Rodith

texts.es:
Rodith, de 44 años de edad, esta casada con Abdias quien se dedica a la agricultura, fruto de esa unión tuvieron  un hijo. Juntos viven cómodamente en su casa propia.El negocio que tiene Rodith es la venta de chifles (plátano frito en bolsitas de plástico), para esto tiene un pequeño puesto ubicado al frente de una posta de salud, donde atiende a su distinguida clientela y también reparte a las distintas bodegas de la ciudad,  se levanta muy temprano para realizar las compras de sus ingredientes para la preparación del día, pagando un precio cómodo que le permite tener un mayor margen de ganancias. Ya  lleva 08 años en éste negocio atendiendo a sus clientes contando con el apoyo de su pareja  para atender al público.
Le gusta su negocio pues le ha traído muchas satisfacciones personales y económicas .Este será el préstamo número 02 con Kiva y se encuentra contento por contar con el apoyo financiero necesario para continuar con sus ventas.Con el monto solicitado de S/.2000 nuevos soles comprará plátanos al por mayor, para  ofertar a sus clientes, así como también los ingredientes para dar el toque de sabor a sus chifles.
texts.en:
Rodith, 44, is married to Abdias, who is a farmer, and they have a son.  They live comfortably in their own home.  Rodith has a business selling chifles (fried bananas in plastic bags) and has a small stall outside a health center where she attends to her distinguished clientele.  She also distributes her products to stores in the city.  She gets up very early to buy the ingredients she needs for the day, paying a low enough price to have a greater profit margin.  She has been in business for eight years and receives support from her husband when attending to the public.

She enjoys her work because it has brought her personal and economic satisfaction.  This is her second Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support necessary to continue with her sales.  She will use the 2,000 PEN loan to buy bananas wholesale, as well as other ingredients to give her chifles that special touch.

loans.use: To buy bananas and other ingredients to make her products.

loans.name: Santa Clara Ii San Pedro Group

texts.es:
el señor Juan, de estado civil Unido de Hecho, cuanta con 47 años de edad, de escolaridad 4 años primaria, tiene 4 hijos y todos estan estudiando; él se dedica a la agricultura especifícamente al cultivo de Café, este negocio o trabajo ha sido por años tradición de su familia y a la fecha él lleva 30 años de experiencia en el ramo. 

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizatrá para la compra de abono para sus cultivos de café, y en el futuro quiere que cada año tenga abundante y buenas cosechas; los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al cultivo de Café, maíz y frijol.

En la foto no aparecen 2 integrantes porque no pudieron asistir en la reunión cuando tomaron la misma.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan lives in a common-law marriage and has four children, all of them in school. He is 47 years old and studied four years of primary school. Juan works in agriculture, more specifically growing coffee, a family tradition with which he has worked for thirty years.

Juan started a group to request a loan to buy compost for his coffee plantations. In the coming years, he wants to have good and abundant harvests. The remaining members grow coffee, corn and beans. Two of them could not come when the picture was taken.

loans.use: to buy compost for his coffee plantations.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy grocery items for grocery selling business

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Abena did not have access to any formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Abena sells limes and oranges in Emissakrom  (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 15 years. As a widow with eight children, Abena uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Abena will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of limes and oranges, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Abena wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of limes and oranges.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of three young children from CPG, Bohol. Marites has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than five years now. This is their source of income.

Marites is asking for a loan to buy a new engine for the boat and fishing nets. With these, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Marites has hopes of expanding their fishing business so that it will generate more income for the family.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for the boat and fishing nets

loans.name: Rasif

texts.en:
Rasif  is 41 years old, a married man with five children. He breeds cattle and sells them for meat purposes to local butchers. Rasif has 10 years of experience in this field, thanks to his father who taught him the best way to look after cattle. Hard life conditions and unemployment pushed him to start his own business. 

Rasif usually buys calves and raises and fattens them over five to six months. Then he resells them for a profit at the local livestock bazaar. Meat selling brings him 500 AZN in income per month. People use beef in everyday national dishes as 'pilau' and 'dolma' and always use yogurt sauce. 

This is the only income in Rasif's family and not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Rasif applied for a loan of 2000 AZN to purchase three baby calves, one cow and fodder. This will be his third loan and Rasif   has a very positive client history.

loans.use: to buy three baby calves, one cow and fodder.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca, requiere de un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de invertir en el negocio. Esta inversión le permitirá mejorar el local de ventas y lo demás para comprar pan dulce y francés, así tener variedad para brindarles a los clientes. 
El crédito anterior le permitió aumentar sus utilidades y ganancias. Las circunstancias familiares se mantienen y la calidad de sus ventas han mejorado.
texts.en:
Blanca is in need of a new loan to invest in her business.  This investment will allow her to renovate her sales stall and to buy sweet and french breads in order to offer her customers variety.

The previous loan helped increase her profits.  Her family circumstances have remained constant and her sales volume has improved.

loans.use: To renovate her sales stall and to buy sweet and french breads.

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
María tiene 55 años de edad es casada tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo en Guaranda provincia de Bolívar.

Es Integrante de la VRC ALLY ÑAN está conformada por 10 socios que son de la misma comunidad, está ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina.

María se dedica al comercio de ladrillo, además se dedica a la agricultura a la siembras de maíz, cebada, trigo.

Solicita el crédito para comprar  tierra, moldes, semillas, urea, herbicidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para las siembras y el otro trabajo.

El sueño es que el negocio propere.   Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia. En el tiempo libre le gusta cuidar a los nietos.
texts.en:
Maria is 55 years old, married and has a son.  She lives with her husband and son in Guaranda, within the Bolivar province. 

She is a member of the VRC ALLY ÑAN communal bank, made up of ten members from the same community, located 20 minutes from the office.

Maria sells bricks and also farms and raises corn, barley, and wheat.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy dirt, pots, seeds, urea, and herbicides.  This loan will help here buy what she needs for her plantings and other work.

Her dream is for her business to prosper.  Her challenges are the competition that she faces.  She likes to care for her grandchildren in her spare time.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Even though Efua grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. Currently, Efua is an entrepreneur. She sells fried fish in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began six years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their five children. 

Efua has identified that there is a growing demand among consumers’ for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more fish to fry and subsequently sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to fry and subsequently sell.

loans.name: William Alexander

texts.es:
William, tiene un ciber café; lo hace desde hace 6 años y lo realiza solo en una casa alquilada  de un pariente también  es maestro de banda instrumental, este lo aprendió de sus padres.
El crédito que solicita le permitirá comprar repuestos para la computadora y accesorios para ello. Este lo invertirá en el financiamiento del ciber y así poder ayudarles a las personas bridándole sus servicios.
Su objetivo es ayudar a su madre a tener más ingresos para el hogar y así tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
William owns an internet café. He has had it for six years and works alone, in a house he rented from a relative. William is also an instrumental orchestra conductor, something he learned from his parents. 

William is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for his computer and some accessories. This is an investment for his café that will benefit people with the provision of different services. William’s goal is to help his mother to have a better income and thus a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories for his computer.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is divorced and has an only child. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Ama is a successful businesswoman. She sells fried and smoked fish in Esissamkrom (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about seven years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ama uses her income to provide for the entire family.

 Ama will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of fish to smoke and fry, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fish to smoke and fry

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Efua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘Banku’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionately and cooked in hot water into a smooth whitish consistent paste). She usually sells her ‘Banku’ in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling ‘Banku’ for 3 years. 

Efua is married and has 4 children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Efua wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘Banku’. In the long term, Efua plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of cassava and maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Hisham

texts.en: Hisham is a 40-year-old carpenter who works in his own carpentry workshop where he has few machines. He is applying for a loan to get more wooden material to increase his productivity and to get new tools for fixing his machinery.

loans.use: to get more wooden material and new tools.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio de compra de mercadería. Este le invertirá en la adquisición de vitaminas para adultos y niños.
El crédito anterior le permitió incrementar sus inventarios y mejorar sus ingresos. Las circunstancias familiares han mejorado y las condiciones económicas se mantienen igual.
texts.en:
Juan is requesting a new loan because he needs to invest more in purchasing merchandise.  He will invest this loan in the acquisition of vitamins for both adults and children.

The previous loan allowed him to grow his inventory and to improve his profits.  His home circumstances have improved and economic conditions have remained constant.

loans.use: to buy vitamins for adults and children.

loans.name: Babygirl

texts.en:
Babygirl is 33 years old and lives in Paynesville which is one of the populous areas in Montserrado County; she is married and has three children between the ages of one week old and six years old. They all live at home and two attend school. She was unfortunate to be unable to attend school, but she is good at managing her business. Her husband is a businessman.

 For the past eight years she has been selling biscuits, candy, etc. in the local market. Now she faces no problems. She sells every day and spends 12 hours with her business. She started this business with a little income she received from her revolving savings account ('susu' club). She is requesting a loan to purchase more biscuits, candy, etc. for her business. She hopes to build herself a house.

loans.use: to purchase more biscuits, candy, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en: Merly is a farmer from the town of Ubay, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of six children. Merly has been in the farming business for more than 10 years now, together with her husband. Merly is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm . With these, they will be able to improve their farm and eventually their harvest. In the future, Merly has hopes of expanding their farm so that it will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Even though Ekua grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for herself and her family. Currently, Ekua is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and wrapped in banana leaves) for a living. She primarily sells her ‘Kenkey’ in Emissakrom (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 5 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their 5 children. Ekua has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her ‘Kenkey’. However, she is unable to meet their needs due to a limited inventory. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty ‘Kenkey’. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty ‘Kenkey’.

loans.name: Ma. Janice

texts.en:
Ma. Janice is 29 years old, married, and has two children. She has been seven years in a retailing business which is selling soap, eggs and spices in their village. She is managing her business well and has been able to gain a higher income and give her children a better way of living.

She wanted to extend the variety of products she sells to her customers, products that are seldom sold in their village, but which she knows are needed by the people in their village. She is requesting a loan of P50,000 to buy beverages, canned goods and shampoo to sell. She hopes to earn a higher income from the business by offering their needs.

loans.use: to buy beverages, canned goods and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Neomi

texts.en:
Neomi is 33 years old and lives in the West Point community, which is a populated area in Montserrado County. She is single with two children whose ages are twelve and eighteen. Both of her kids are going to school. Neomi is educated and is a successful businesswoman. Her partner is a businessman. 

Over the past 4 years she has being selling frozen chicken in the local market without facing any serious problems. This business started with a little amount she got from a Susu club (Saving Accounts). She spends 12 hours every day at her business. Neomi is requesting a loan to purchase more chicken by the carton to expand her sales.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken by the carton to expand her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 53 years old and a hardworking and diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and three sons. Her husband and all of her sons are running a car decoration and accessories shop. This is the only source of income for her family. Currently they are facing many problems in the business because the current stock of car accessories is almost gone and they have no funds available to purchase more stock. 

Rukhsana has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can continue his business and purchase a new variety of car accessories and decoration kits, like car chargers, fog lights, seat covers, neon lights, etc. With the profit amount she is going to make arrangements for the marriage of her son and for the expansion of their business. She is very hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for them, and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their help.

loans.use: To purchase a new variety of car accessories.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie is 35 years old and lives in the West Point community, a populated area in Montserrado County. Her education ended in 5th grade; she is a married woman living with her husband and four children.  Her children range in age from 10 to 15; they are all attending school. Her husband is a serious businessman. 

Mamie is selling charcoal by the bag in her community; she does not face any problems with her business. She started cooking food, which led her to  the charcoal business. Over the past four years, she has being doing this business in the local market/vicinity without facing any problems. 

Mamie is requesting a loan of 20,000 LRD to buy more charcoal to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Aaron

texts.en: Despite being orphaned at a young age, losing six of his seven siblings, and only having had seven years of schooling,  Aaron has risen above his circumstances to become a well-respected and compassionate member of his community. Aaron has a family of five, a growing business, and supports ten orphans, providing them shelter in his native Uganda and helping them to attend school. Aaron hopes to better support his loved ones by buying and selling more improved firewood cookstoves which use 50% less firewood. These stoves save his customers money in reduced  firewood needs or save them time in collecting firewood. They also reduce emissions of toxic gases which  improve health outcomes in his community. With the help of a Kiva Loan, Aaron will be able to consolidate his business's product offerings while simultaneously generating needed income to send his children and dependents to school.

loans.use: to pay for improved firewood cook stoves

loans.name: Al-Bdor Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Bdor and consists of 6 ladies in Yemen. They are hardworking women who are running their businesses to increase their income. They applied for a loan of 280,000 YER from AMB. 

Halima is the leader of group. She is a 41-year-old married woman and has 4 children. They all live in Dhamar, Yemen. Halima is a housewife who dreams of offering a good life to her family. They live in an old house, so she faces difficulties in improving their living standards. 

She intends to buy construction supplies, but unfortunately the amount of money she has isn't enough, so she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER. She hopes to pass through difficult situations to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her old house.

loans.name: Mwaminifu Group

texts.en:
Christina, who is in her early 30s, is married with three children, one son and two daughters.  Two of her children go to school but the last one is still small. She has been running two businesses, selling clothes door-to-door and selling chips.  She works from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Christina's 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start selling chips and also to increase her stock of clothes. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used her profit to pay school fees and to cover household expenses. She will use this loan to improve her selling place and to open another chips place. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

Christina will share this loan with her loan group, "Mwaminifu", which has 10 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to improve her selling place and to open another chips place.

loans.name: Susano

texts.en:
Susano is a 48-year-old married man from CPG, Bohol; he is the father of five children. 

Susano earns a living through his seaweed farming business, which he has been doing for over ten years.  This is the source of his income. 

Susano is asking for a loan to buy seaweed seedlings, rope, net, and other items. With this, Susano will be able to improve his seaweed farming,  augmenting his harvest and yield.

loans.use: to buy seaweed seedlings, rope, net, and others items for his seaweed farming business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 47-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She has two children, ages 10 and 13. 

The source of her income is the rice farming business, which she has been doing for five years. She usually earns 3,000 PHP a month.

Rebecca is requesting for a loan to buy a rice thresher, which is used for the separation of grain from stalks and husks. With this loan, she will be able to buy such equipment for her business.

In the future, Rebecca hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a rice thresher for her business.

loans.name: Khurram Abbas

texts.en:
Mr. Khurram Abbas is a 28-year-old married man who is the father of three children. He owns a bangles shop in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Khurram Abbas would like to purchase a variety of bangles in various colors to sell. For this reason, he has requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. He is hopeful that the loan will help him improve his business. He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their assistance.

loans.use: to purchase variety of bangles in various colors to sell.

loans.name: Janat

texts.en:
Janat lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is divorced with four children, three of whom attend school. She also looks after her sister. Janat rents a house with access to electricity but without piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

Janat has been selling secondhand clothes in the market for two years, working six days a week. She does not earn any additional income.
She has requested a loan of UShs 300,000 from MCDT- SACCO to allow her to purchase skirts, blouses and shirts for sale. Her challenges include seasonality and transportation. Her dream is to be able to own a big shop to wholesale all kinds of clothes.  She joined MCDT because of their interest in people with small businesses like herself.

loans.use: to buy more skirts, blouses and shirts to sell in the market.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 63-year-old married man with nine children in Kagadi, Uganda. Due to his need to earn a living, he started a local brew and produce selling business twenty years ago. With the proceeds, he has been able to pay school fees for his children and do farming. He dreams of educating his children up to the university, even though he did not have a chance to further his education due to his parents' poverty conditions. 

Stephen is requesting a loan to buy local brew to sell.

loans.use: to buy local brew to sell.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en: Beatrice is a twenty-six-year-old tailor. She in unmarried and does not have any children. Beatrice's tailoring income is limited by not having enough capital to expand her business. She is joining the KOMAZA microforestry program so that she may use the profits from her tree farm to expand her business and build rental houses.

loans.use: To pay for eucalyptus seedlings, fertilizer, training and plantation maintenance support

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a twenty-eight-year-old married man with one child who is twelve years old living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a teacher by profession and works eight hours a day. He was inspired to join the service by his desire to nurture the children of this nation. Like most government employees, he is dissatisfied with the low salary, which comes in late, and his dream is to set up a retail shop so as to meet his family's daily expenditure.
Moses intends to use a loan to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy merchandise  such as soap and sugar to start a retail shop.

loans.name: Zahida Group

texts.en:
Zahida is a 41-year-old housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along with her husband and five children. Three of her children are currently studying in schools. Her husband has been running a vegetable shop for thirteen years. His monthly income is too low, and because of that they are facing many problems in life.

Zahida, as a member of a two-person group, has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can expand his business. He would purchase more vegetables in large quantities and at a lower price from the villages and then sell them here for a profitable amount. Zahida wants to pay the educational expenses of her children after getting the profits. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for helping them.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her vegetable shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To arrange a wedding for his son

loans.name: Perlas Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento PERLAS está compuesto por nueve integrantes, siete mujeres y dos varones ,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Mary en la foto se encuentra ubicada en el centro la de la blusa celeste,  se dedica a la venta de variedad de refrescos en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en un mercado muy concurrido de loa ciudad de Santa Cruz,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Mary va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de refrescos por mayor para surtir su puesto de venta   y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio la Sra. Mary es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada ya que este préstamo le permitirá crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
The "Perlas" communal bank is made up of nine members, seven women and two men. The president of the bank is Mary, who is in the center of the photo wearing a light blue shirt. Mary makes a living selling a variety of soft drinks from her stall, which is located in a very busy market in the city of Santa Cruz. This loan is her second with the institution. 

Mary will use this loan to buy a variety of wholesale soft drinks to stock her stall, which will allow her to offer a variety of products to her clients. Her reason for applying for this loan is to continue improving her business. Mary is a very hardworking person, and she is happy with this opportunity because this loan will allow her to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of wholesale soft drinks to stock her stall.

loans.name: Aaron Bryan

texts.es:
Aaron es un joven d 19 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Aaron se encuentra estudiando la carera profesional de Administración de Empresas, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Locro para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Aaron trabaja como obrero operario en una empresa de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 9 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Aaron se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir sus gastos de estudios, como pago de matrícula y compra de materiales (libros, separatas, cuadernos y otros), de esta manera Aaron podrá seguir cursando sus estudios con el deseo de convertirse en un gran profesional, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio negocio.
texts.en:
Aaron, 19, is single and lives in the city of Ica with his parents and siblings. He is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to succeed. 

Thanks to his efforts and the support of his parents, Aaron is studying a professional degree in Business Administration. In his free time, he likes to listen to music and he sometimes cooks a delicious "Locro" stew to share with his family.

By his own initiative and with plenty of effort and dedication, Aaron works as an operator for a company in his city. He works every day for about 9 hours per day, and he believes that it is going well because of his good performance and the friendly manner in which he treats others.

Aaron is very grateful for the Kiva lenders, because thanks to their help he will be able to cover the costs of his education, such as matriculation fees and the purchase of supplies (books, supplementary materials, notebooks, and others). Aaron will then be able to continue studying, with the hope of becoming a great professional. He will keep working and putting in effort to achieve his great dream of owning his own business.

loans.use: to cover educational expenses.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
MARLENY  tiene 31 años de edad es casada tiene 31 años de edad tiene cuatro hijos, vive con el esposo y los hijos en la ciudad de Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.

Es Integrante de la VRC ALLY ÑAN está conformada por 10 socios que son de la misma comunidad, está ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina.

 MARLENY  se dedica al comercio de ganado, se dedica a la agricultura a la siembras de maíz, trigo y fréjol, además se dedica a la  crianza de cerdos, pollos.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, herbicidas, fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta en las siembras.

El sueño es tener  un negocio rentable.   Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia. En el tiempo libre le gusta pasear y dedicarse a los hijos,
texts.en:
Marleny, 31, is married with four children. She lives with her husband and their children in the city of Guaranda in the province of Bolívar. She is a member of the Ally Ñan communal bank, which is made up of ten members from the same community, located twenty minutes away from the office.
