Marleny makes a living in livestock and agriculture. She plants corn, wheat, and beans, and she also raises pigs and chickens. 

She has applied for a loan to buy seeds, urea, herbicides, and fertilizer. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy everything that she is lacking for her crops.

Her dream is to have a profitable business. The challenge which she faces is competition. In her free time, she likes to take walks and take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, herbicides, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kaneez Group

texts.en:
Kaneez is a 33-year-old hardworking and diligent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, along with her husband and son. Her husband is a government employee but his salary is very low. Her son is currently studying and it’s very difficult for them to pay for his educational expenses. 

Kaneez is a beautician by profession. Since 2005, she has operated her own beauty salon. Currently the beauty stock of the salon is almost depleted. Therefore, Kaneez would like to purchase a variety of new cosmetic products to continue her business. 

As a member of a four-person borrowing group, Kaneez has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase beauty products such as facial creams, lipsticks, scrubs, makeup kits, hair colors and other products. She would also like to buy some new chairs for her salon. 

With the profits she earns, she plans to extend her business by opening an additional beauty salon. She dreams of living a happy, healthy and peaceful life with her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their support. 

Note: In the picture, Kaneez is raising her hand.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products such as facial creams, lipsticks, scrubs, makeup kits, hair colors and other products.

loans.name: Yassah

texts.en:
Yassah is 35 years old and lives in the West Point community, which is overpopulated. It is situated in Montserrado County. She did not attend school, but she is good at managing her business. 

Yassah is married with five children between the ages of 11 and 15. They all live at home with their parents and four of them attend school. 

Yassah sells palm nut oil at the local market. Over the past six years, she has being doing this business and is now requesting a loan to buy more palm oil for her business.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 47-year-old farmer from Ubay, Bohol. She is a married woman and has four children. Victoria has been into farming for more than 10 years now. This is the source of their income. Victoria gives her best to support her husband in tilling their land.

Victoria is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay the school fees of her children. In the future, Victoria hopes to make their business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy grocery items for the grocery selling business

loans.name: Bukurije

texts.en:
Bukurije is a Roma.  She is thirty five, married and has two children, twelve and nine years old. They reside in a main city in central Albania.

Bukurije has been selling used clothes at her community’s market for the past five years. With this income she has been able to feed her children;.  Her husband doesn’t have any activity of his own, but he helps his wife. 

Bukurije now wants to buy some second-hand clothes for the spring season, and a loan of 70,000 Albanian Lek will help her do just that.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes to resell

loans.name: Kosar Group

texts.en:
Kosar is 36 years old, independent and a hardworking woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband and six children. Her husband, and two of her sons, are laborers.  

Kosar and her family are facing a lot of problems in life due to the low monthly income.  Kosar is a responsible woman and she is helping her husband to meet the household expenses, by selling bangles, bracelets and other ornamental items.  She has five years of experience with this business. As a member of a four person group, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan, so she can buy a variety of bangles, bracelets, key chains and necklace in large quantities. 

She will expand her business from the profit and save some money for her children's marriage.  She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for helping them.   NOTE: In picture Kosar is raising her hand

loans.use: To purcahse ornamental items bracelets, bangles

loans.name: Ahliddin

texts.ru: Ахлиддину 46 лет. Он живет на севере Таджикистана вместе со своей семьей. Он женат на доброй женщине и имеет 4 детей. Его жена домохозяйка и занимается воспитанием детей. Он более 11 лет занимается скотоводством. Его местожительство весьма благополучно для скотоводства и он доволен своей работой, так как справляется с легкостью. Он знает все тонкости своего дела и старается развевать свой бизнес дальше. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки скота. Этот займ поможет ему увеличить оборотный капитал и таким образом получить больше дохода. Он планирует купить телевизор с полученного дохода для своих детей, которые уже давно просят его. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Ahliddin is 46 years old. He lives in the northern part of Tajikistan with his family. He's married to a very nice woman; together they have four children. While his wife stays at home and takes care of the kids, Ahliddin runs a cattle ranching business. He's had this business, which is located in a very convenient place, for the past 11 years. Ahliddin is familiar with all the nuances of his business, so he's able to complete his job easily and be very satisfied with his work. 

Now, he's trying to expand his business and is, therefore, asking for a loan of 2000 soms, which will enable him to purchase some heads of cattle. This will increase his working capital and will allow him to achieve higher profits. With these profits, he'd like to purchase a television, something his children have been asking for a long time. He's hoping for your help.

loans.use: To buy cattle for the purpose of increasing working capital.

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka is 38 years old. He lives in Dmanisi District, with his 37 year old wife Patima and retired mother Eter. Mamuka requested loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions.

Family has three milk cows. The cows are milked every day to make cheese and sell it locally at the markets, to get a small daily income. Their additional income is Mamuka’s mother’s monthly pension.

Mamuka requested loan from Credo to start a family business. His loan request was approved by the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program involves providing business start-up and re-startup credit, with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit since they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the credit Mamuka will purchase a truck. He wants to start working on private orders to transport a variety of cargo. This will help him to earn additional income for the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of their family.

loans.use: to purchase a truck

loans.name: Teresa Rosa

texts.es:
Teresa es una mujer de 42 años, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Guadalupe con sus cuatro hijos,  a quienes ama y son su  principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia,  ya que ella es padre y madre para sus hijos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Teresa no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Psicología, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar un riquísimo Cuy Chactado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Teresa trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes y bebidas, adicionalmente los fines de semana trabaja como obrera de campo en algunos fundos agrícolas de su ciudad, Teresa trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Teresa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de abarrotes, como arroz, azúcar, leche, menestras y otros, de esta manera Teresa tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Teresa is a 42 year old woman.  She lives in Chiclayo in the Guadalupe district with her four children.  She loves her children, and they are her main for reason for living.  She is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person.  She puts all of her efforts into getting her family ahead because she is both father and mother to her children.  

Sadly, due to the lack of resources and the need to work since she was very young, Teresa was not able to study the career of psychology.  In her free time she likes to cook the delicious ‘Cuy Chactado’ [fried guinea pig] to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with great determination and dedication, Teresa works in a small business selling groceries and drinks.  Also, on the week-ends she works as a field worker on some of the agricultural farms in her city.  Teresa works every day for approximately ten hours.  She believes that is going well for her due to the good prices and the kind service that she offers to others.

Teresa is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help given to her she will be able to buy a greater quantity and a variety of groceries like rice, sugar, milk, mixed vegetables, and others.  This way Teresa will have her store better stocked, and she will be able to tend to more customers.  This way she will continue working and putting forth great effort in order to fulfill her big dream of being able to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and a variety of groceries like rice, sugar, milk, mixed vegetables, and others.

loans.name: Jessica Isabel

texts.es:
Jessica, solicita un nuevo prestamo por la necesidad de seguir invirtiendo en el negocio. Este le permitira comprar cuatro cerdos para engordarlos y luego venderlos. 
El credito anterior le permitio crecer y tener mayores ingresos. Las circunstancias familiares han cambiado y las condiciones economicas han mejorado, ya que poseen una estabilidad en los ingresos.
texts.en:
Jessica is requesting a new loan, aware of the need to continue investing in her business. This loan will help her to buy four pigs to fatten and sell them.

The previous loan helped her to grow and increase her income. Her family’s conditions have changed and the economy has improved, now that they have a stable income.

loans.use: to buy four pigs and sell them when they are fat.

loans.name: Jerrling

texts.en:
Jerrling is 19 years old and lives in the West point community, which is a populated area in Montserrado County. She is single with two children ages three and eight who go to school. She herself is educated and is a potential business woman. Her partner is a businessman.

Over the past 3 years she has being selling slippers in the local market, without facing any serious problems. This business started with a little amount she got from a Susu club (saving accounts). She sells everyday, spending 12 hours at her business everyday. She is requesting a loan to purchase cartons of fashion slippers.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion slippers for sale

loans.name: Beautiful Girls 2 Group

texts.en:
Vincenta is the featured borrower of Beautiful Girls 2 group. She joined with the other group members to apply for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua because they have always been friends since they came to Lebanon from the Philippines to make a living.

Vincenta is a 37-year-old mother of one child. She works as a housekeeper to make sure that her child will have the best living ever. The requested loan will be invested in paying for her child's living expenses back in the Philippines. She hopes that one day she will make her own business in her hometown and live with her child again, so they can take good care of each other. She is the first one from the right in the photo.

Herlymar is a 34-year-old single woman who works as a housekeeper to financially support her family in order to have a good living. She is the first one from the left.

Ma. Theresa is a 49-year-old single woman who also works as a housekeeper to provide her family with the best living.

loans.use: To pay for her child's living expenses back in the Philippines.

loans.name: Matu

texts.en:
Matu is 23 years old and lives in the West Point community, which is situated in Montserrado County. She is an 11th grade dropout, and she is married to a businessman. She has two children with ages of 1 year and 5 years; one of them is attending elementary school. 

She sells cold water and soft drinks in her community. She has being doing this for the past three years and has not encountered any problems. She is requesting a loan to buy more cold water and soft drinks for her business.

loans.use: to buy more cold water and soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Iftikhar

texts.en:
Mr. Iftikhar is a 33-year-old hardworking man. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan. He is a father of five children. He sells milk in the area, which is the only source of income for the family. His wife also helps him in the business. He sells the milk in the main market and door to door.

Presently, Mr. Iftikhar is interested in purchasing a buffalo to grow his business. By purchasing a buffalo, he will be able to cope with the huge number of customers. He is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for his family and business. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a buffalo to sell milk.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio de venta de productos de belleza.  Este le ayudara a comprar lociones, cremas, cosméticos, entre otros productos.
Con el crédito anterior mejoro el negocio, incrementaron las ventas y el inventario. Las circunstancias  familiares se mantuvieron igual y sus condiciones económicas han mejorado.
texts.en:
María needs to ask for another loan in order to keep on investing in her cosmetics sale activity. The loan will help her buying lotions, creams and cosmetics among other products.
She used her previous loan to improve her activity, by increasing her sales and supplying her stock. She lives in the same household and her economic conditions have improved.

loans.use: To buy  lotions, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Rama I Group

texts.fr:
Apollinaire fait partie du groupe  Rama I et  habite à  kayanza. Il  a 50 ans et est marié  à Judith, une  cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 10 enfants.
Il prend soins de son neveu qui étudie.

Il fait le commerce des habits depuis 15 ans. 

Il est à son dixième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’habits  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, il voudrait avoir un bon logement et voir ses enfants mener une bonne vie.
texts.en:
Apollinaire lives in Kayanza and is a member of the Rama I group. He is 50 years old and married to Judith, a grower. They have ten children. He cares for his nephew, who is in school.

He has been buying and selling clothes for 15 years now.

He is on his tenth loan through Turame. With the Kiva loan that he receives, he will increase his capital and buy lots of clothes to resell in order to earn more money.

In the years to come, he would like to have a good place to live and see his children lead good lives.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy lots of clothes to resell so that he can earn more money.

loans.name: Al-Saleh Group

texts.en:
The Alsaleh group consists of four women who live in Dhamar, Yemen. They requested a loan from AMB for 200,000 YER. 

Faiza is 33 years old, married, and has four children. She is a housewife who hopes to improve her children's living conditions. She is the breadwinner of her family but the money she has saved is not enough to cover her children expenses. She is requesting a loan from AMB for 50,000 YER, which she will use to buy a computer for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Dukundane Ii Kb Group

texts.fr:
J de Dieu fait partie du groupe  Dukundane II KB et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il  a 32 ans et est marié  à Adidja, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 2 enfants âgés de 2 à 3ans  dont l’un étudie.
Il prend soins de 2 personnes adultes.

Il fait le commerce des pièces de rechange auto (clignotants, ampoules,…) depuis 10 ans. 

Il est à son dixième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de pièces de rechange (clignotants, ampoules,…)  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, il voudrait acheter une parcelle et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
J de Dieu is a member of the Dukundane II KB group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 32 years old and married to Adidja, a vendor. They have two children together, two and three years of age, one of whom is in school. He also has two adult dependents.
He has been selling auto spare parts (turn signal lights, bulbs etc) for 10 years. He is on his second loan with Turame. Thanks to the Kiva loan, he will bolster his capital and stock up on auto spare parts (turn signal lights, bulbs etc) for resale in order to earn more. In the future, he would like to buy a plot of land and provide for his children’s education.

loans.use: to stock up on auto spare parts (turn signal lights, bulbs etc) for resale in order to earn more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase used items to sell.

loans.name: Songa Group

texts.en:
Basil, who is in his late 20's, is single. He has been running a business of electronic money transfer for almost one year now. He works from 9:00 am to 8:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Basil used the previous loan to increase the stock of electronic money transfers and has paid back his loan successfully. He used the interest to cover household expenses. He will use this loan to improve his business by expanding  the space where the customers stand while waiting for their turn and to increase the stock of the business. His dream is to one day be able to own a car spare shop. 

Basil will share this loan with his loan group "Songa" with 10 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to improve his business by expanding  the space where the customers stand while waiting for their turn and to increase the stock of the business.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 66 años de edad, esta casado y tiene tres hijos. Desde hace cuatro años se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde. Aprendió este oficio, ya que toda su vida trabajo como jornalero, debido a que nunca asistió a la escuela por la pobreza en que Vivian sus padres. Los pollos los mantiene en jaulas pequeñas elaboradas de varas de tijuilote, tablas y maya ciclón. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 200 pollos, concentrado, vacunas y vitaminas. De esta manera, ahorrara tiempo y dinero al realizar un solo viaje, también estará seguro que al terminar cada ciclo sus pollos tendrá los ingresos necesarios para subsistir. Su sueño es, construir granjas grandes y comprar una vaca lechera.
texts.en:
Francisco is 66 years old, married, and has three children.  For four years he has made a living raising chickens for fattening.  He learned this job since he has worked all his life as a laborer, due to the fact that he never attended school because his parents lived in poverty.  He keeps the chickens in small cages made of sticks of "tiguilote" (the White Manjack tree), boards, and chicken wire.

The loan that he is requesting from Fundación Campo is for 200 chickens, concentrated feed, vaccines, and vitamins.  This way he will save time and money by making only one trip.  Also, he is certain that after his chickens finish each cycle he will have the income that is necessary to survive.  His dream is to build large farms and to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy 200 chickens, concentrated feed, vaccines, and vitamins.

loans.name: Lamzira

texts.en:
Lamzira is 45 years old. She lives in Batumi district with her husband, 25-year-old son and 23-year-old daughter-in-law. Lamzira is trading with vegetables. She is buying from the resellers at the wholesale price and selling locally at the market with a small price mark-up. Her husband is an artisan and works on private orders to get small additional income for the family.

Lamzira requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. Lamzira requested a loan from Credo to start-up family business. Her loan request was approved in the frames of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, which do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Lamzira will purchase a stock of vegetables and renovate the small store house that she owns. She will buy a big stock from the resellers at low cost and sell at a good price through the whole season. This will bring her a good profit. With part of the profit, she will buy stock for the future and expand her trading business and another part she will use for her family's well-being.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of vegetables and renovate the small store house

loans.name: Zoe

texts.en:
Zoe is 31 years old and lives in the West Point community, which is a populated area in Montserrado county. She is single with two children, ages 3 and 10. Both of her kids are going to school. Zoe is a high school graduate and she is a potential businesswoman. Her fiancé is not working. Notwithstanding, Zoe manages her business well to enable her to support her home. 

Over the past 2 years, Zoe has been running a medicine store in the local market without facing any serious problem. This business started with a little amount she got from her fiancé. She sells everyday, spending 10 hours with her business. In so doing, she is requesting a loan to purchase more paracetamol, quinine, aspirin, ibuprofen, etc. for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more paracetamol, quinine, aspirin, ibuprofen, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Fayziniso

texts.en:
Fayziniso is 63 years old. She is a very hard-working and active woman. She is married and has three children who are adults. She has seven grandchildren. Her husband is a builder and has a small salary. The income of her children and her husband is not enough to provide the grandchildren with modern conveniences. 

Fayziniso is a good sewer and she wants to organize her own business, sewing national women's dresses. With this aim, she studied at the course ‘To Get Ahead' and got enough skills about business. She will manage the business alone. She will be a very successful businesswoman since she is hard-working and smart. 

She is asking for a loan of TJS 1000 (somoni) to buy fabrics for organizing her new business. She plans to buy a computer for her grandchildren from the profits. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Beronico

texts.es:
Beronico, de 53 años de edad, es viudo y vive en compañía de su madre y sus 04 hijos en su casa .Beronico se dedica a la agricultura, tiene un terreno propio de 36 hectáreas de extensión,  en donde realizará la siembra de palma aceitera de al menos 06 hectáreas  ya que éste producto tiene bastante demanda en la actualidad siendo este un cultivo alternativo . Lleva en éste negocio más de 07 años, para apoyarse contrata hasta 02 peones a los que paga un jornal de 20 nuevos soles diarios cada uno, además de contar con el apoyo de sus hijos.
Considera rentable su negocio por la demanda que tiene éste producto y las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Comenta le agrada su vida de campo pues le ha traído muchas alegrías como los ingresos económicos para pagar los gastos propios de su hogar, viendo los buenos resultados que tiene, piensa continuar en su actividad y expandirse aumentando el número de hectáreas de palma aceitera sembrada al doble del que ya tiene.
Este es el préstamo número 03 con  Kiva, se siente contento de contar con un apoyo financiero para concretar sus proyectos.Con el monto solicitado de S/.1500 nuevos soles, comprará abono orgánico para sus cultivos de palma aceitera.
texts.en:
Beronico, 53, is a widower who lives with his mother and four children in his house.  Beronico makes a living in agriculture.  He has his own 36-hectare plot of land where he'll grow at least six hectares of oil palm trees because of the current demand for this alternative crop.

He has been in this business for more than seven years.  He hires up to two laborers to help him, paying each one 20 nuevos soles [PEN] per day.  He also has the support of his children.  He considers his business profitable because of the demand for this product and the good profits it gives him.

He says he enjoys his country life because it has brought him great joy such as the income to pay his own household expenses.  In light of his good results, he plans to continue with his job and expand, doubling his hectarage of planted oil palms.

This is his third Kiva loan.  He's happy to have the financial support to firm up his plans.  With the requested amount of 1500 nuevos soles he'll buy organic fertilizer for his oil palm crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.es:
Esmeralda tiene 39 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, vive en la ciudad de Tela, Atlantida.
Esmeralda es un amujer muy emprendedora, hace tres años comenzo su propio negocio de elaboracion y venta de comida y refrescos. vende comidas rapidas, alamuerzos desayunos, atendiendo a sus clientes todo el dia. este negocio lo ha mantenido con crecimiento por su buena administracion y por reinversion de utilidades, lo que le ha permitido tener mas clientes y ser reconocida. Actualmente solicita un prestamo para comprar insumos como condimentos, carnes, arroz, manteca, frijoles,etc. para la elaboracion y venta de comida. Su meta es hacer crecer su negocio y darle una buene educacion a sus hijos y mejorar las condiciones de su hogar.
texts.en: Esmeralda is 39 years old. She is married and has 2 children, and she lives in the city of Tela, Atlantida. Esmeralda is a very enterprising woman. Three years ago, she started her own business preparing and selling food and beverages. She sells breakfast, lunch and snacks. She serves her customers all day. She has been able to keep her business growing thanks to her good management and by reinvesting her profits. This has allowed her to serve more customers and to become well-known. Currently, she is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as condiments, meat, rice, shortening, beans, etc., to prepare and sell her food. Her goal is to make her business grow, provide a good education to her children, and improve the conditions of her household.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as condiments, meat, rice, beans, shortening, etc. to prepare the food she sells.

loans.name: Alfredo Valentin

texts.es:
Alfredo es un joven muy trabajador y entusiasta, vive en la ciudad de Imperial, en el distrito de San Luis, el cual se caracteriza por tener un clima muy variado y sobre todo se desarrolla mucho la agricultura en especial se cultiva la manzana, el maíz, entre otros. Alfredo vive al lado de sus padres, a quienes quiere mucho y a los cuales apoya con el fruto de su trabajo. A Alfredo le hubiera gustado estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Mecánica, ya que debido a sus pocos recursos económicos solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria.

Día a día Alfredo trabaja como obrero agrícola, el se levanta desde muy temprano para salir a trabajar, ya que busca a sus clientes para poder realizar los trabajos de sembrío, riego, fumigación, entre otros; él cree que está saliendo adelante porque es responsable y tiene muchas ganas de mejorar.

Alfredo está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva  ya que gracias a ello podrá comprar 2 mochilas de fumigación con la cual podrá mejorar su trabajo ya que actualmente tiene que alquilar las mochilas en una zona alejada; de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos y poder seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Estudiar la carrera de Mecánica y poder tener un mejor empleo”.
texts.en:
Alfredo is a very hard-working and enthusiastic young man. He lives in the city of Imperial, in the district of San Luis, which is known for having a very varied climate. Above all, agriculture is widespread there, especially the cultivation of apples and corn, among other crops. Alfredo lives with his parents, whom he loves very much, and whom he helps with the fruit of his labor. Alfredo would have liked to study for a degree in Mechanical Engineering, but due to his scarce economic resources, he was only able to study up to the fifth year of secondary school. 

Day after day, Alfredo works as an agricultural laborer. He gets up very early to go out to work, since he goes to his clients to carry out work such as planting, watering, and fumigation, among other tasks. He believes that he is getting ahead because he is responsible and he has a great desire to improve. 

Alfredo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to this he will be able to buy 2 fumigation backpacks, which will allow him to improve his work, since he currently has to rent the backpacks in a faraway zone. In this way he will be able to improve his income and continue working hard to achieve his greatest dream: "Studying for a degree in mechanics and getting a better job."

loans.use: to buy two fumigation backpacks.

loans.name: Abena Group

texts.en:
Abena, Comfort, Hasiah, Aishetu, and Vivian are the members of Abena Group. They sell rice porridge, tomatoes, cereals, cosmetics, and engine oil, respectively. They have been together since 2010. 

Abena is a 53-year-old woman who is married to Samuel, a 55-year-old mason. She has been with ID Ghana for the past two years and is doing very well with her business. 

She has been doing this business for three years now. She works from Monday through Saturday. She is thankful for ID Ghana’s training on savings, otherwise she would not have made it this far. 

This is Abena's fourth loan and she needs GHS 800 to buy more rice, sugar, and milk to prepare rice porridge to sell to her customers. 
 
All five partners need a total amount of GHS 4,100 to buy more goods to sell to their customers in the community.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, and milk to prepare rice porridge to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos,   solicita un nuevo crédito para empezar la siembra del cultivo de regadillo y adquirir los insumos agrícolas. Este le permitirá comprar abono, insecticidas, herbicidas, plaguicidas y semilla. 
Con el préstamo anterior mejoro la producción y aumentaron las ganancias.  Las condiciones económicas incrementaron,  gracias a ello logro adquirir electrodomésticos para el hogar y mejorar la vivienda.
texts.en:
Carlos is requesting a new loan in order to start sowing and watering the crops and to get agricultural supplies.  This will allow him to buy natural fertilizer, insecticides, herbicides, pesticides, and seeds.

With the last loan he improved the production and increased the profits.  His financial situation improved.  Thanks to this he managed to get some domestic appliances for his home, and he improved his house.

loans.use: to buy natural fertilizer, insecticides, herbicides, pesticides, and seeds.

loans.name: Songambere Group

texts.fr:
A. Marie  fait partie du groupe Songambere et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 49 ans et est mariée  à Laurent, un commerçant.

Elle fait le commerce de  patates douces depuis  32 ans. 

Elle est à son vingtième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de patates douces à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Grâce aux bénéfices, elle nourrit sa famille.
texts.en:
A. Marie is part of the Songambere group and lives in Gitega. She is 49 years old and is married to Lawrence, a retail merchant.

She has been trading sweet potatoes for the past 32 years.

This is her twentieth credit loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan, she will increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of sweet potatoes for retail sales, to earn more.

Thanks to the profits she feeds her family.

loans.use: increase her working capital and buy a large quantity of sweet potatoes for retail sales, to earn more.

loans.name: Murvat

texts.en: Murvat is 54 years old, married and the father of three children who range in age from 21 to 26 years old. His two daughters are married and have children and his son in the army, where he hopes to have a career. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income for the family.  He lives in the Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border. He is applying for his second loan from Kiva to buy fruits and vegetables to sell. He will use the 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) loan to buy potatoes, onions and cabbage to sell at local bazaars. He will use the additional income he earns from this loan to better care for his family. In the future, Murvat wants to have his own store in the bazaar and buy a car to transport vegetables and fruits. These changes will make his business more profitable. Murvat is thankful to Komak and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Taya

texts.en:
Taya is 39 years old and lives in the West Point community, a populated area in Montserrado County. She is married, with three children, ages 10, 12, and 19. All of her children are going to school and live at home. 

Unfortunately, Taya did not attend school, but she is a potential businesswoman. Her partner is a businessman. Taya manages her business well. Over the past five years, she has being selling door locks, hinges, catches, nails, etc. in the local market without facing any serious problem. This business started with a little money she got from her husband. She sells every day, spending 12 hours with her business. 

Taya is requesting a loan to purchase more door locks, hinges, catches, nails, etc.

loans.use: to purchase more door locks, hinges, catches, nails, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Pandan Wangi 2 Group

texts.en: Sri is 43 years old, married and the mother of two sons. Her husband is a seasoning mixer in a Japanese restaurant, but his income is not large enough to pay all of the family's expenses.  Five years ago, Sri decided to help her husband by going into the business of selling clothes on credit. She sells school uniforms, jeans, blouses, and various kinds of veils. She runs her business from her house and sells to her neighbors. She hopes to earn enough money to repair her house. She earns 1,500,000 IDR per month in her current line of work, and one day hopes to open a fried-chicken business.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair her house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a large number of cabbages that she will sell to earn more income.

loans.name: Luis Francisco

texts.es:
Luis de 33 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de pescado en el municipio de Soledad, municipio área Metropolitana de Barranquilla. Su negocio data de hace 25 años,  pues es parte de la  tradición familiar y desde muy niño vivió entre pescado s, cuando junto a su padre se dedicaba a la pesca, para  posteriormente vender los productos en la plaza del mercado. Con su negocio ha logrado sostener a su familia, conformada por su cónyuge y su hija de 13 años, que espera ver convertida en una profesional exitosa. Sus ventas las realiza de manera ambulante,  de contado, en una jornada diaria que inicia  desde las 4 de la mañana, hasta el medio día. 
En la actualidad compra a mayoristas que le ofrecen gran variedad de pescado y muy fresco; por eso con ellos establece las mejores negociaciones, especialmente cuando tiene suficiente capital de trabajo,  para comprarles y obtener descuentos, por compras en volumen. Su meta mas adelante es tener un local y brindarle a su familia un mejor nivel de vida, por eso se esmera buscando las mejores alternativas comerciales, para aumentar su clientela y ganar más dinero. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento, que hace  a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará pescado para atender la temporada, teniendo en cuenta los encargos de su preventa, razón por la cual la inversión de su credikiva tiene gran probabilidad de éxito.
texts.en:
Thirty-three-year-old Luis sells fish for a living in the municipality of Soledad in the metropolitan area of Barranquilla.  His business is 25 years old as it is part of a family tradition. Fish has been his life since he was a little boy, when together with his father he would go fishing and then sell their catch in marketplace.  His business has allowed him to support his family, which is made up of his common-law wife and their 13-year-old daughter, whom he hopes to see become a successful professional.  He makes his sales on foot, in cash, during work days that start at four in the morning and last until midday.

He currently buys from wholesalers who offer a wide variety of very fresh fish.  He gets his best deals with them, especially when he has enough working capital to buy in volume and get discounts.  His future goal is to have a storefront and to offer his family a better quality of life.  This is why he takes great pains to find the best commercial alternatives to increase his clientele and make more money.  He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, which is the first loan he is taking out with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use it to buy fish to be supplied for the season, taking into account his presale orders, which are the reason his investment of this loan is very likely to be successful.

loans.use: To purchase fish for resale

loans.name: Konah

texts.en:
Konah is 46 years old and lives in the West Point community which is populated and well-known in Montserrado County. She is a widow with children whose ages are 16 and 30 years old. One of the children is in school, while the other is working. 

Konah is not educated, but she is a very good business manager. For the past three years, she has been running a cook shop (restaurant) where she sells delicious Liberian food, along with cold water and soft drinks without encountering major problems. The business emerged from the monthly earnings of her daughter. 

She is requesting a loan to buy more stocks of rice, oil, pepper, dried meat, dried fish, etc. for her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice, oil, pepper, dried meat, dried fish, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Yanneth Ysabel

texts.es:
Yanneth es una mujer de 21 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su padres y hermanos, lamentablemente Yanneth perdió a su madre cuando era muy pequeña, desde entonces ella ha dedicado todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante al lado de su familia, ella es una persona muy trabajadora, alegre y entusiasta, no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, ya que desde muy joven tuvo la necesidad de trabajar, pero le hubiera gustado mucho cursar estudios de corte y confección.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación Yanneth trabaja como cantante de música folklórica, ella anima ciertas fiestas y reuniones, Yanneth ensaya todos los días con sus música y arregla sus vestimentas, ella puede trabajar por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por el trato amable y la alegría que le pone a sus canciones.
Yanneth se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar las mejoras y la renovación de sus vestimentas, de esta manera podrá contar con trajes mas colorida, alegres, con detalles de su región, así pues Yanneth seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser una cantante reconocida.
texts.en:
Yanneth is a 21-year-old woman, is single, and lives in the city of Cañete in the district of Imperial with her parents and siblings.  Unfortunately, Yanneth lost her mother when she was very young; since then she has devoted all of her effort toward moving ahead in life with her family.  She is a very hard-working, happy and enthusiastic person.  She was not able to study for a professional career because from a very young age it was necessary that she work, but she would have really liked to study dressmaking.

On her own initiative, with much determination and dedication, Yanneth works as a singer of folkloric music.  She livens up parties and gatherings.  Yanneth rehearses her music every day and prepares her outfits.  She can work for about 10 hours and believes that it is going well due to her friendly manners and the happiness that she puts into her songs.

Yanneth is grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they offer she will be able to improve and renovate her outfits.  This way she will be able to sing in suits that are more colorful, cheerful, and have details from her region. Thus, Yanneth will continue working and pushing herself to achieve her great dream of being a well-known singer.

loans.use: to improve and renovate her outfits.

loans.name: Gororoka Group

texts.fr:
Julienne fait partie du groupe Gororoka et  habite à  Muramvya. Elle a 36 ans et est mariée  à Joseph, un enseignant. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 7 à  20 ans.

Elle fait le commerce produit vivriers (bananes, patates douces, pommes de terre) depuis 8 ans. 

Elle est à son treizième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de pommes de terre  à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années à venir, elle voudrait  acheter des champs pour cultiver les ananas à vendre.
texts.en:
Julienne is a member of the Gororoka Group and lives in Muramvya. She is 36 years old and is married to Joseph, a teacher. Together they have five children between the ages of seven and twenty years old.

Julienne has been a merchant selling foodstuffs (bananas, sweet potatoes, potatoes) for the past eight years and is on her thirteenth loan cycle with Turame. The loan she receives from KIVA will allow her to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of potatoes that she will resell to earn more income.

In the coming years, Julienne would like to purchase fields so that she can grow pineapples to sell.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of potatoes that she will resell to earn more income.

loans.name: Basorat

texts.en: Basorat is married and has two children who are 16 and 18 years old. She has always wanted to provide them with a good education and since her husband’s income from farming is not enough to do this, she decided to start a new business in the field of animal husbandry. She studied the course at an organization called "To Get Ahead," which helps women get certificates. She has now graduated and her husband will help her with the business. She is asking for a loan for 3,000 somoni to buy cattle, which she will care for for several months and then resell in the local market. Her goal is to use the loan to get her new business off to a strong start and provide for her family. She is very grateful to have the support of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy cattle for her new business.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is 20 years old, married and recently decided to go into business out of her home so that she can improve her living conditions before having children. She goes to a wholesale market and free-trade zone in Aqaba to get bedding at a low price, and then sells these items at the market price out of her home. She is applying for a youth loan to buy more bed cover sets and other items from free-trade zone to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy more bed cover sets to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Alicia

texts.es:
ROSA tiene 57 años de edad de estado civil unión libre, no tiene hijos, vive con los familiares en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Rosa se dedica a la venta de comida. Solicita el crédito para comprar una cocina industrial, ollas más grandes. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace mucha falta. Las compras las realizará en Ventanas.

El sueño es comprar un solar. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es esforzarce y trabajar más. En el tiempo libre le gusta descanzar.
texts.en:
Rosa is 57 and in a common-law marriage. She has no children and lives with her family in Ventanas, Los Rios province.
Rosa sells food. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of an industrial stove and larger pots. With this loan she will be able to buy what she needs. She will make her purchases in Ventanas.
Her dream is to buy a plot of land. She tries hard to work hard and to work more. In her free time she likes to relax.

loans.use: to buy an industrial stove and larger pots.

loans.name: Orifjon

texts.ru: Орифджон  добросовестный, целеустремлённый и трудолюбивый человек. Он родился в сельской местности, который имеет хорошее условие для животноводства и выращивания сельскохозяйственных культур. Семья Орифчона, была  малообеспеченной, и он с детства помогал родителям по скотоводству и выращивания сельхоз культуры. Орифджон перенес много тягости жизни, так как жил в малообеспеченной семье. После окончания средней школы, Орифчон женился,  и построил себе маленький домик, для временного проживания своей семьи. Данный момент у него четверо детей. Он должен перестроить дом по новой планировке, так как семья уже большая.  В основном он занимается продажей лекарства в аптеке, которая находится в близи его дома. В этом году им надо перестроит дом.  Поэтому Орифчон обращался  в нашу организацию с целью получения займа для покупки строительный материалов, чтобы перестроить дом.  Орифчон надеется на Вашу благотворительность и милосердие.
texts.en: Orifjon is a conscientious, goal-oriented and hard-working person. He was born in rural area, where the conditions for raising livestock and farming produce are good. Orifjon’s family had a low income, and he started helping out his parents raising livestock and farming produce early on. He has had to face many hardships due to his family’s low income. After finishing secondary school, Orifjon got married and had a small house built in order to house his family temporarily. At present he has four children. He needs to have his house remodeled and expanded since he now has a large family. He mainly sells  pharmaceuticals in a drugstore near his house. This year the family needs to have the house remodeled. This is why Orifjon applied to our organization with the goal of obtaining a loan to buy construction materials in order to have construction work done. Orifjon is hoping for your charity and compassion.

loans.use: to buy  construction materials for rebuilding  his house.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en: Virgilio is a fisherman from CPG, Bohol. He is a married man and has been in the fishing business for more than 5 years.  Fishing is the source of his income.  Virgilio is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, nylon, lead weights, hooks and other items.  With this, he will be able to improve his catch and augment his fish sales to the market. In the future,  Virgilio hopes of making his venture a success and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, nylon, lead weights, hooks and other items

loans.name: Babra

texts.en:
Babra is a 28 year old hardworking woman, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She lives with her husband, two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a driver. Three of her children are currently studying in schools. Her husband’s salary is not enough to meet the educational and household expenses. Since 2007, she has been stitching clothes and she is very experienced in sewing dresses. She has been operating her business very efficiently and honestly and her clients always appreciate her work.

Babra has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount, she wants to purchase a new sewing machine as the old machine is not working properly and it’s very difficult for her to continue the business. She can increase her production by stitching more dresses in less time and she can work efficiently with a new sewing machine. With the profit amount she wants to pay the educational expenses of her children. In future she wants to open a tailoring center in her house. She is very hopeful that the loan will be very productive for her sewing business.

loans.use: New sewing machine to stitch more dresses

loans.name: Prinecess T.

texts.en: Princess is 27 years old and lives in the West Point community, which is located in Montserrado County. She is a high school graduate and a married woman with no child at present.  She sells dry goods like soap, toothpaste, hair grease, hair relaxer etc  around the city. She started her business by selling charcoal in her community.  Princess has being doing this business for the past four years and is not facing any problem.   She is requesting a loan to purchase more soap, toothpaste, hair grease, hair relaxer etc for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more soap, toothpaste, hair grease, hair relaxer etc for her business.

loans.name: Naveed Iqbal

texts.en:
Mr. Naveed Iqbal is a 41 year old hardworking man. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan with his family. His family consists of 5 children and a wife. He owns a small electrician shop in the area which is the only source of income for his family. He works very hard to fulfill the needs of his family.

Presently he is interested in purchasing cell wires, cables, bulb, switches and variety of electronic products to sell. For that, he has requested for a loan amount of 100,000pkr from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will help him to increase his monthly net income and savings for the future. He is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for his family.

loans.use: To purchase vaiety of electronic products to sell.

loans.name: Dickson Group

texts.en: This loan group is made up of four people who live in the town of Dansoman. They are Dickson, Abena, Mercy and Elizabeth, and have been together since June 2011. They have done well and earn a living by buying beverages, dried fish, charcoal and other items to sell to their customers. Dickson, who leads this group, is a beverage seller who is 39 years old, married and the father of three children, all of whom are in school. He has been in this line of work for eight years and has taken out and repaid three previous loans from ID Ghana. He is requesting a new loan, for GHS 1,400, to expand his business and ensure that he is meeting the needs of the people who live in his community. The entire group is requesting a loan for GHS 3,300 to buy more goods to sell to their respective customers.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Mouzah

texts.en: Mouza is a 41-year-old single lady. After her father passed away she has been living with her mother and younger brother. To make a living Mouza embroiders women’s dresses. She also does some tailoring work when needed. Now Mouza is applying for a loan to buy more threads and new embroidery tools.

loans.use: to buy more threads and new embroidery tools.

loans.name: Reham

texts.en:
Reham is a 34-year-old lady. She has been doing flower arranging from her house to help her husband improve their standard of living. She also has opened a small food market to support the family. 

Reham is now applying for a new loan to support her food market business, and buy more food products.

loans.use: to buy more food products.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
Maria Rosa tiene 45 años de edad, es casada, y tiene 7 hijos, vive con su familia en San Juan Pueblo.
Hace un tiempo Doña Maria decidio dedicarse al negocio de cria y venta de cerdos, tambien adicionalmente para generar mas ingresos vende comida. ahora quiere hacer crecer su negocio aumentando la cantidad de animales. Ha solicitado varios prestamos con Odef para mantener el negocio. Actualmente solicita uno de 10,000 lempiras para comprar mas cerdos para la cria y venta, espera incrementar la cantidad de animales y póder recibir mas ganancias. Ya que su meta es sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Rosa is 45, married, and has 7 children. She lives with her family in San Juan Pueblo.
Some time ago, Maria decided to start a business raising and selling hogs. She also sells food in order to generate more income.
She now wants to expand her business by increasing her number of animals. She has taken out several loans from Odef to maintian her business.
She is now requesting a loan of 10,000 lempiras for the purchase of more hogs for raising and sale. She hopes to increase her number of animals and to be able to make more income. Her goal is to get her family ahead.

loans.use: to buy hogs for raising and sale.

loans.name: Donald Henry

texts.es: El señor Donald habita en el municipio de Masaya, junto a su familia, su mayor sueño es terminar su casa y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, el elabora Sandalias para comercializarlas, con este financiamiento comprara Materiales como  Cuero, Pegamento, Fibra, Suelas de Sandalias. con esto podra incrementar mas su inventari y obtendra mayores ingresos, Agradece le apoyo que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado con este credito.
texts.en: Donald lives with his family in the municipality of Masaya .  His greatest dream is to finish his house and to improve his living conditions.  He manufactures sandals to sell and will use this loan to buy raw materials like leather, glue, fiber and sandal soles.  He will be able to increase his inventory this way to earn higher income.   He is grateful for the support Afodenic and Kiva have granted him by means of this loan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Assana

texts.en:
Assana is married and has six children. She has received some form of schooling until the end of middle school. Assana sells provisions in Abura, which she has done for some time now. Her husband is unemployed. 

As the sole provider in the family, Assana uses her income to assist her husband in paying their family's expenses and saving for their children's futures. Assana will use the loan to purchase an increased quantity of provisions to sell. Therefore giving her customers more variety to choose from. With the new profits from her expanded business, Assana plans to develop her provisions shop further and meet her rising customers' demand.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of provisions to sell.

loans.name: Peter Awotwe

texts.en: Peter is a small scale carpenter in Aburansa (near Cape Coast). He has had some form of formal education as he is a middle school graduate. He is married and has three children. His wife is a petty trader. Peter has been working as a carpenter for close to 15 years. His income is used to help his wife pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. He plans on using his loan to purchase an increased quantity of wood, thus allowing him to meet rising customer demands. He hopes to use the profits from his enterprise to develop his business further and ensure that all his children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of wood, thus allowing him to meet rising customer demand.

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en:
Kwame is married and has three children. He has received some schooling, until the end of junior high school. Currently, Kwame sells powdered milk in Aburansa (near Cape Coast). He has been involved in this industry for about 10 years. His wife is an oranges seller. Kwame’s income goes towards helping his wife pay for the family's general expenses.

Kwame will use the loan to purchase a greater quantity of powdered milk cans from his supplier, hence this will increase his existing powdered milk capacity. Consequently, this will allow him to increase his overall sales. With the new profits from his expanded enterprise, Kwame plans to develop his business further, by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase his existing powdered milk capacity.

loans.name: Mervat

texts.en:
Mervat is a 32-year-old conservative woman; she asked her husband to appear in the photo instead.

Mervat has a small general store at home where she is selling some types of cleaning products. She is now working on expanding the business so it would include selling food products. For that, she is applying for this loan.

loans.use: to add food products.

loans.name: Ali Raza

texts.en:
Mr. Ali Raza is a 33-year-old, hardworking man. He owns a small costume jewelry shop in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

He wants to purchase a variety of costume jewelry to sell that includes bangles, necklaces, rings, etc. 

He has requested a loan of 120,000 PKR from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. The loan will help him purchase items to sell, and will gradually help him  increase his net income and savings. 

Ali Raza is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of costume jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Veronica Karina

texts.es: La Sra. Veronica  tiene 33 años, ella se dedica al comercio minorista, ofreciendo variedad de productos como billeteras, monederos de distintos   ella  vende de ,manera ambulante visitando calles barrios y mercados ofreciendo sus productos,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  La Sra. Verónica  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mercadería  de billeteras al por mayor,  La Sra. Verónica  enfrenta retos en su negocio que es la demanda que hay de nuevos productos y va a utilizar los beneficios en una mejor atención y comprando variedad de productos, La Sra. Verónica  se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Sra. Veronica is 33-years old.  She makes her living selling retail.  She offers a variety of products for sale, like wallets and different styles of purses.  She travels to make her sales, visiting street stalls, neighborhoods and markets.  This is Sra. Veronica's first loan sequence with the Institution.  Sra. Verónica is going to use the loan to purchase merchandise, like wholesale wallets.   Sra. Verónica faces challenges in her business, like the demand for new products.  She is going to use her profits to provide better service and purchase a variety of products.  Sra. Verónica feels happy about and grateful for the Institution and the support they have offered by granting her the loan.

loans.use: to purchase whole-sale merchandise.

loans.name: Natalia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Natalia es una joven de 20 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Imperial, la cual se caracteriza por su clima variado y por su agricultura, en especial el cultivo de maíz, manzana, entre otros. Natalia es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, sobre todo a pesar de las adversidades por la cual ha atravesado. Ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado Estudiar Repostería.

Día a día Natalia trabaja como obrera agrícola, ella trabaja en los campos de cultivo realizando diferentes actividades como por ejemplo sembrado, cosecha de productos, entre otros; con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, ella cree que está saliendo adelante  porque es responsable y le gusta trabajar.

Natalia agradece el apoyo que le han brindado los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a su gran ayuda podrá comprar una vitrina y golosinas al por mayor para poder iniciar su negocio de venta de golosinas en su domicilio, de esta manera ella podra tener un ingreso extra y de esta manera seguir luchando por mejorar su calidad de vida y poder hacer realidad  su más grande sueño:” Estudiar Repostería y tener su panadería propia”.
texts.en:
Natalia is a young 20-year-old living in the city of Imperial noted for its variable climate and for agriculture, especially the growing of corn and apples, among others.  Natalia is a young woman who very much wants to get ahead especially despite the adversities she’s gone through.  She was only able to complete fifth grade of secondary school but would have loved to study pastry making.

Day to day, Natalia works as an agricultural laborer; she works in the fields doing various chores like planting and harvesting, among others.  She’s able to help her parents with household expenses with the fruits of her labor.  She believes she’s doing well because she’s responsible and likes to work.

Natalia is grateful for the support Kiva lenders have given her because thanks to their great help she’ll be able to buy a display case and snacks at wholesale to start a business selling snacks at home.  This way she’ll have a way to earn extra income to continue striving to improve her quality of life and make her greatest dream a reality: to study pastry making and own a bakery.

loans.use: to buy a display case.

loans.name: 18 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “18 DE DICIEMBRE”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María Isabel es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de dulces, venta de chamarras, venta de ropa, venta de botones, confección de deportivos, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María Isabel es integrante, ella indica que un año y medio que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta comida; mismo que decide emprender hace varios años al observar que este negocio era rentable para otras señoras.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de mesas y sillas) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y el ahorro.
texts.en:
The “18 de Diciembre” communal bank will start its third cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Juan Pablo Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided over by María.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses like neighborhood store, candy sales, jacket sales, clothes sales, button sales, sportswear making and food sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like María Isabel.  She indicates that she’s been a member of Pro Mujer for a year and a half having joined thanks to an invitation from a girlfriend of hers who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a business selling food that she started several years ago when she noted that this was a profitable business for other ladies.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy tables and chairs in street markets in El Alto and then sell in her sales space.  This way of working allows her to earn resources as best possible for her home since she’s in a common law relationship and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answers that she likes the credit and the savings.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Maria Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
María, se le presenta la necesidad de adquirir un nuevo préstamo para invertir más en el negocio ya que le genera utilidades. Este le permitirá comprar ropa para damas y también peluches.
Con el crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar sus ventas e incrementar el inventario. Las condiciones económicas y familiares se mantienen igual.
texts.en: María needs a new loan to invest more in her business because it generates profits.  This will make it possible for her to buy women’s clothes and stuffed toys.  The previous loan helped her increase sales and inventory.  Her economic and family conditions remain the same.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes and stuffed toys.

loans.name: Ok Mufakose Vendors -A Group

texts.en:
Raphael managed to buy additional household assets, and the standard of living of his family has improved greatly, with the profits of the previous loan. The loan has improved the liquidity of the business, also. He is still looking forward to expanding into more markets. Raphael is very happy with the services being offered by KIVA and hopes that the program will extend to provision of funds for housing, because he wishes to have a house of his own.

Raphael has requested a new loan, in the amount of $600, to buy vegetables to resell.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Mogga Sam

texts.en: Mogga's progress from his first loan allowed him to buy more clothes for resales and paid part of his children school fees. Now he is taking another loan to increase his working capital. He is happy for Finance Sudan's support of his business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Even though Alberta grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family.

Currently, Alberta is an entrepreneur. She sells cooked rice in Akatakyiwa (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 2 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their lone child. Alberta has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product, but she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity, so she aims to use her loan to purchase more rice to sell.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Alberta wants to buck the trend by ensuring that her child will be given an opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to sell

loans.name: Issahaku

texts.en: Issahaku is married and has no children. She has received schooling to senior high school. Issahaku is a petty trader who deals in the sales of ground pepper in Hohoe, which she has done for three years. Her husband is a lab assistant. Issahaku uses her income to pay for the general upkeep of her home and her mother. Issahaku will use this loan to purchase an increased quantity of dried peppers and food produce for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Issahaku plans to increase her working capital. In the long run, she aspires to have enough savings to one day start a family.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of dried peppers and food produce for resale.

loans.name: Seidu

texts.en:
Seidu is married and has one child. She has received schooling only till the end of primary school.  

Seidu sells jewelry and second-hand clothes at Hohoe, which she has done for five years. Her husband is a driver. Seidu uses her income to help her husband pay their family's general expenses.  

Seidu will use the loan to buy more earrings and bracelets, thus helping her meet rising customer demands. In addition, she plans to further diversify her business by starting to sell children's clothes as well. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Seidu plans to save for her child's future and reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to buy more earrings and bracelets and to introduce the sales of children's clothes in her business.

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en:
Felecia, 29, is married, and lives in Airport with her husband and children. Her children are between the ages of three and thirteen and are in school.

Felecia sells soft drinks and dry bush meat in the local market. She started doing so with money given to her by her husband and learned how to sell from her mother. The main problem she faces in her business is the rainy season.

Felecia is applying for a 16,000 LRD from BRAC Liberia to buy increased amounts of soft drinks and dry bush meat to sell. Her ambition is to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy increased amounts of soft drinks and dry bush meat.

loans.name: Mattawa

texts.en: Mattawa is 43 years old and lives in Margibi county, which has the largest rubber-producing plantation in Liberia, with her husband and children. All her children are in school and are between 10 and 25 years old. For six years now she has been involved with the sale of food ingredients in the market. She was taught and helped by her mother. Two years now since she started selling ice, she makes more profit every day. She is asking for a loan to buy more ice for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to buy more ice for her business

loans.name: Tete

texts.en: Tete is 31 years old and lives in the West Point community which is well known in Montserrado County. She is single with two children, ages 9 and 10 years old. Both are in school and live at home with their mother. She sells tubs and buckets in the local market every day. She has sold the goods for the past two years without any serious problems. She started this business with a little income from her fiancee. She is requesting a loan to buy more tubs and buckets for her business. She plans to build a solid foundation for her children.

loans.use: to buy more tubs and buckets for her business.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio, de 56 años, es soltero y vive sin ningún familiar en su localidad, ya que su familia se encuentra en otra parte del pais.  Tiene una casa propia, desde donde día a día trabajaba para brindarse una mejor calidad de vida .El trabajo de Gregorio consiste en la agricultura, se dedica a la siembra y cosecha de dos productos fundamentales para la zona en la que vive, el cultivo de palma aceitera y la producción es vendida a una industria muy grande dedicada a la elaboración de aceite pero también se dedica al cultivo de cacao que es vendido a los diversos compradores que vienen de otros lugares en busca de estos productos ya que en la región se producen los mejores en este fruto. Ambos cultivos son fomentados como alternativos al cultivo de hoja de coca.Lleva ya 06 años trabajando con el cacao y hace 04 años con la palma aceitera, lo hace solo y cuando hay temporadas de siembra y cosecha contrata a algunos trabajadores que le ayudan a cumplir con los pedidos a tiempo.Le gusta su trabajo pues está en contacto con la naturaleza y es un ambiente en el cual se siente muy cómodo, ama lo que hace, le va bien y espera poner una empresa dedicada a la transformación del cacao de materia prima a producto elaborado.Este es el  préstamo número 05 con Kiva y manifiesta estar muy agradecido con la oportunidad que le dieron para poder introducir más inversión a sus productos.
Con el monto solicitado de S/.2500 soles, comprará abono para sus cultivos de palma aceitera y cacao orgánico.
texts.en:
Gregorio, 56, is single and lives without any relatives in his town because his family is located in another part of the country.  He has his own house, where he works every day in order to give himself a better quality of life.  Gregorio's work consists of agriculture; he makes a living planting and harvesting two products fundamental to the area in which he lives. His palm oil crop and product is sold to a very large industry dedicated to making oil, but he also makes a living through the cocoa crop, which he sells to various buyers who come from other places in search of these products because the region produces the best of these fruits.  Both crops are promoted as an alternative to the coca leaf.

He has six years of experience working with cocoa and four years of experience with palm oil plants.  He works alone, and when there are planting and harvesting seasons he hires some workers who help him complete the orders on time.  He likes his job because he is in contact with nature and it is an environment in which he feels very comfortable.  He loves what he does; it is going well and he hopes to form a business dedicated to transforming the cocoa as a raw material into a finished product.  

This is his fifth loan with Kiva and he is very grateful for the opportunity they gave him to invest more in his products.  With the requested amount of 2500 soles he will purchase fertilizer for his organic palm oil and cocoa crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio, de 28 años de edad, esta casado con Lisbith y tiene una hija de 6 años con quienes vive en su casa propia.Lucio se dedica a la agricultura, para eso tiene su terreno propio de 20 hectáreas de extensión, en donde tiene 03 hectáreas de sembríos de cacao orgánico, además de  tener cultivos de plátanos, maíz, estos últimos para el consumo de su hogar. Lleva más de 10 años en está actividad y le gusta su trabajo ya que puede estar en el campo y tener contacto con la naturaleza , donde se siente muy a gusto, además que le brinda lo necesario para vivir cómodamente, y para educar a su  hija, que es su mayor orgullo, por eso se siente con muchas ganas de progresar y mejorar sus técnicas de cultivo comprando un tractor agrícola .Este es el préstamo número 06 con Kiva, por tanto cuenta con su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos.
Con el monto solicitado de S/.1500 soles comprará abono orgánico para cacao y asi mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Lucio, 28, is married to Lisbith and has a 6-year-old daughter; they all live together in his own house.  Lucio works in agriculture and owns a 20-hectare parcel of land on which he has three hectares planted with organic cocoa beans; in addition he also grows bananas and corn that he grows for home consumption.  He’s been in this activity for more than 10 years and likes it because he can be out in the countryside and be in contact with nature where he feels very comfortable in addition to it generating what’s needed to live comfortably and to educate his daughter who is his greatest source of pride.  Because of this, he very much wants to make progress and improve his farming techniques with the purchase of a tractor.  

This is his 6th loan with Kiva so he can count on your collaboration to continue with his objectives.  He will use the requested 1,500 soles to buy organic manure for the cacao thus improving the quality of his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva lives in Margibi county, which is the largest producer of rubber in Liberia. She is 25 years old and single with two children, ages 1 and 3. Only one is currently in school and they both live at home. The children's father is a businessman. For the past ten years she has been selling palm oil in the local market. She spends 9 hours selling her palm oil, and most of the time, she uses a bus to get her palm oil to her business. She enjoys the profit she makes from her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil for her business

loans.name: Twinkle Group

texts.en:
Ladie is the featured borrower of Twinkle Group and with the other members applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua. They have been friends since they came from the Philippines to work and make their living.
Ladie is in the photo on the left. She is a 42-year-old divorced woman who works selling mobile phones and prepaid cards to make her living. Her loan would be invested to increase her business income with newly released mobile phones and accessories, in addition to the highly requested prepaid cards.  
Maribeth is the second from the right in the photo. She is 35-year-old married woman who works as a housekeeper to provide her family a good living. 
Mary Rose is a 35-year-old divorced woman who is working hard as a housekeeper to improve her living conditions. She is at the far right in the photo.
Jacqui-lou is a 33-year-old married woman who works as a housekeeper to improve and develop her family's social and financial situation.
The requested loan will help Ladie, Mary Rose and Jacqui-lou cover their families' expenses and improve their living.

loans.use: To buy newly released mobile phones and prepaid cards

loans.name: Princess

texts.en: Princess is 29 years old and lives in West Point, a very crowded community that is well known in Montserrado County. She is single with a 10-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. Her child's father is a businessman who assists her with some business procedures. She sells rice by the cup in and around the local market every day. The business has being on going for the past year. Since then, she has not encountered any problems from her business. She is requesting for loan to buy more rice by the bag for her business. She plans someday to build her dream house.

loans.use: to buy more rice by the bag for her business.

loans.name: Hamamaoko Group

texts.en: The last loan that Precious borrowed was used to purchase jeans, t-shirts, skirts and kids' shoes for resale.The loan resulted in increased profits due to improved stock levels. Her standard of living has also improved and fees are also no longer a problem. Precious is currently requesting a loan of $500 to buy clothes and shoes for resale. She still sees herself owning a boutique.

loans.use: to buy clothes and footwear for resale

loans.name: Good Hope Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 64-year-old Elizabeth from Harare. She is married with four children, one attending school. She also cares for one dependent. Elizabeth is into tailoring of clothes and knitting jerseys. The business has been in operation for one year. She says the main challenges faced are power cuts, lack of proper structures to sell from and competition from other sellers. Elizabeth has requested a loan of $750 to buy clothing and wool for knitting jerseys for the winter. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase the family's cash flow and also enable her to pay fees for her nephew. In the future, Elizabeth plans to have her own clothing shop.
