loans.use: to buy clothing for resale and wool for knitting jerseys

loans.name: Shefa

texts.en: Shefa is 32 years old and married. She is the mother of a boy and a girl. Shefa sells sheep from their barn. She is now applying for a loan to increase the number of sheep she has in order to increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase more sheep

loans.name: Glen View 4 Vendors Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 39-year-old Rumbidzai from Harare. She is married and has four children, two of whom attend school. She also cares for two dependents. Rumbidzai sells fruits and vegetables such as potatoes, tomatoes, onions, cabbages, and oranges. Her business has been in operation for 19 years. She says the main challenges she faces are lack of working capital and competition with other sellers. Rumbidzai's portion of her group loan is 700 USD. She will use the loan to purchase more vegetables and fruits for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase the family's cash flow and quality of life. In the future Rumbidzai plans to have her own fruits-and-vegetables shop.

loans.use: To purchase farm produce for resale

loans.name: Sarah Group

texts.en:
A mother of 4 (four) children, Lily raises pigs in her home yard. Lily used to weave when she was younger, but with age, she couldn’t continue and shifted her business into the piggery when she availed a loan for the first time. She is pictured here with her hand raised and is the featured member of Sarah Group. Their group is 13 strong and all of the group members belong to a tribal community. The group members share the same thoughts and analogous principles. This is the binding force to carry on with their activity and leads them in development.

Lily says that starting a business in a place like where she lives is difficult. She also adds that the lack of demand for woven products, a bigger market and low capital paralyze her business activities. Lily used to weave to supplement the family income but stopped after she experienced a backache because of the back straps she used for weaving.  Lily now raises pigs and sells them when fully grown in the village and nearby villages. Lily makes more money with the piggery than she made when she used to weave. She decided to expand her piggery and raise pigs full time.

With the Kiva loan, Lily is planning to buy more piglets and more feed. Her aspiration to own a large piggery farm can be accomplished if she is successful with her planning. Lily believes that her piggery business will immensely improve the financial condition of the family.  The rest of the group members are engaged in weaving, a piggery, poultry, a paan shop and animal husbandry.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to expand her pig raising business.

loans.name: Progresistas Group

texts.es: Raquel es integrante del grupo Progresistas, es una trabajadora mujer de 41 años de edad que vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos, todos mayores de edad y casados, Daniel tiene 27 años y trabaja en una imprenta, Víctor tiene 24 años y trabaja en una empresa de refrescos famosa y Wendy la menor tiene 20 años y trabaja en un restaurante. Raquel, además de ser ama de casa tiene una tienda de abarrotes, papelería y compra piezas de copiadora; con el crédito surtirá su negocio con papas, galletas, refrescos, dulces y artículos para su papelería. Con la ganancias que Raquel obtiene desea ampliar su casa y de esa forma tener un buen futuro y no batallar con sus gastos.
texts.en: Raquel is a member of the Progesistas group. She is a hard-working, 41-year-old women who has a common-law marriage. She has three children, all of whom are grown and married. Daniel, 27, works in a print shop; Victor, 24, works in a well-known soft drink company; and Wendy, the youngest at 20, works in a restaurant. In addition to being a homemaker, Raquel has a store where she sells groceries and stationery. She also buys copier parts. With the loan, she will stock her business with potatoes, crackers, soft drinks, sweets, and supplies for her stationery store. With her profits, Raquel wants to expand her house, have a good future, and not struggle with her expenses.

loans.use: to stock her store with potatoes, crackers, soft drinks, sweets, and items for her stationery store

loans.name: Ameera

texts.en: Ameera is a 49-year-old hardworking woman. She is well known for the embroidered dresses she makes. Not only do individuals make special orders for embroidered Abaya and dresses, but also shops order quantities from her and sell them in the market. Now Ameera has applied for a loan to buy more materials that are used in embroidery so she can increase her productivity and distribute to more shops.

loans.use: to buy more material to embroider dresses.

loans.name: Affah Group

texts.en:
The group is made up of four individuals who, in 2009, came together to access a loan. They are Esther, Georgina, Ernestina and Bening and all are in the Dansoman community. ID Ghana has been of great service to them since they have been able to grow their small businesses through the credit scheme. They sell cereals, kenkey (cooked corn paste), assorted soaps and charcoal.

Esther is a 41-year-old maize and fish seller. She has four years of experience. She works six days a week (from Monday to Saturday). She is constantly working to improve her business capital. 

This is her sixth loan with ID-Ghana and she is requesting GHS 1,400 to buy more maize and fish to sell to her customers in the community.

The entire group needs a total amount of GHS 3,200 for business expansion and to meet customers’ demand in the community.

loans.use: To buy more maize and fish to sell

loans.name: Lara

texts.en: Lara is a 35-year-old, single lady. She is living with her mother, after her father passed away. Lara is currently a master degree student, majoring in fine art. She is now applying for an educational loan to pay her next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay her next semester fees, working toward her master's degree in Fine Arts.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 42 years old and lives in West Point, a very crowded community that is well-known in Montserrado County. She is living together with her husband and four children at home. The ages of the children range from 9 to 27 years old, and they are going to school. Her husband is a police officer. 

She sells soft drinks and has not encountered any problem since starting the business. Moreover, the business has been ongoing for the past five years, with better improvement. She started the business with earnings from her spouse's salary. She is requesting a loan to buy more soft drinks to resell at her business.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks to resell at her business.

loans.name: Yazan

texts.en: Yazan is a 20-year-old, single guy, who has three younger brothers and a sister. Being the oldest, Yazan holds a few responsibilities in the family; to meet those, he chose to work at a café and study at the university, at the same time. He is majoring in Accounting and is looking to graduate and find a suitable job in his field. Now Yazan is applying for a loan to pay his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees.

loans.name: Jaafar

texts.en: Jaafar is a 20-year-old single guy. After both of his parent passed away, Jaafar was the one responsible to support the family. He is now supporting three sisters and a brother from the money he makes from renting rooms in their apartments. This did not stop Jaafar from enrolling in the university. He is now majoring in finance and banking and working toward a bachelor degree. Jaafar is applying for this educational loan to help him pay for his semester fees so he can continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Areej

texts.en:
Areej is a 20-year-old single lady. She is the only sister of four brothers. 

Areej is a university student majoring in hospital management. She is now applying for a loan to pay for the rest of her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for the rest of her semester fees.

loans.name: Naimah

texts.en:
Naimah is a 52-year-old conservative woman. She asked her daughter Iman to appear in the photo instead.
Naimah’s husband is a taxi driver. They want to support their daughter while she is a college student. For that reason Naimah has applied for this educational loan to pay for her daughter’s semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s semester fees.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 17 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past year, Shamim has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells agro chemical items.
To help expand her business, Shamim has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more agro chemical items to sell, and will help Shamim to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her young sister. Shamim hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her rental houses and build 2 other rooms.
Shamim is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more agro chemical items to sell.

loans.name: Kwale Group

texts.en:
Anna, who is in her late 30s, is married with two children, one boy and one girl, who both go to school. She has been running a grocery business for five years now. She works from 5:00 p.m. to 10:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her sixteenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock the missing items in the grocery, bought a motorbike, bought empty crates for beers, and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the interest to buy a TV deck, a digital TV, school fees and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy a fridge. Her dream is to one day be able to own a car.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Kwale" with 13 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a fridge.

loans.name: Wisam

texts.en:
Wisam is a 20-year-old married lady. Besides being a housewife, she is also a college student who is working on getting a diploma degree. 

She is applying for an educational loan to pay for her semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees.

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en: Ilham is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli. He lives in the Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border. Ilham is 34 years old, married, and has two children, an 8-year-old daughter and a newborn son. His daughter goes to school. Ilham's daughter wants to become a doctor. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income. This is Ilham's second loan from Kiva. He started his new business 8 month ago, selling children clothes. Now he needs a 2000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) loan to buy clothes and shoes for children. He wants to use the money from his new business for his newborn son because he was born 3 months early and they need money to pay the doctors that saved their son. Murad is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting him again.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes that will allow him a higher income and be able to pay the doctor bills from when his newborn son was born.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is 28 years old and lives in the West Point community, which is a populated area in Montserrado County. She is single with a six-year-old child going to school and living at home. She is a high school graduate and her spouse is a classroom teacher. Her business has been operating for the past four years without any problem. She started the business with her fiancee's earning. She needs a loan to buy more earrings, chains etc for her business.

loans.use: to buy more earrings, chains, etc.

loans.name: Teopista's Group

texts.en:
Teopista's Group consists of two hard-working women. Teopista is 22 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. She lives in Wobulezi in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past three years, Teopista has been working hard to manage a small hotel business, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Teopista is requesting a loan from BRAC Uganda for 450,000 Ugandan Shillings, which she will use to stock more food such as maize flour, cassava, and raw bananas for the hotel.  The loan will help Teopista generate greater profits and pay some of the school fees for her children. She hopes that in the future she will be able to build rental houses. 

Teopista is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, cassava, and raw bananas for the hotel.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy lives in West Point, one of the most populous and well-known market areas in Montserrado county. She is 29 years old, stopped her education at grade 3,  and she is  single. For eight years now she has been selling rice, oil, Vita, peppers, etc.  in her community. One of the problems she faces is  small income.  She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she makes  enables her to buy   food for her home. That makes her proud of her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, oil, Vita, peppers, etc. for her business. In the future she hopes  to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, Vita, peppers, etc. for her business

loans.name: Siah

texts.en: Siah is a 30-year-old woman who lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known market areas in Montserrado County. She did not attend school but she said she is good at managing her home affairs and business. She is single with two children aged 2 and 12 who are attending school and live at home. For the past 2 years she has been selling soft drinks, cold water, biscuits, cookies, and juice in the local market. The problem she faces is sometimes slow business. Most of the time she realizes profit and she uses it to sustain her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks, cold water, biscuits, cookies, and juice. She hopes to build a house in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, cold water, biscuits, cookies, and juice.

loans.name: La Pampa Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento LA PAMPA está compuesto por nueve integrantes, todas mujeres,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra. Nancy, ella tiene 45 años tiene dos hijos de las edades de 19 y 10  años,  que se encuentran en edad escolar,   ella se dedica a la venta de comida almuerzo en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la localidad del Torno,  este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Nancy va a usar este préstamo para compra de insumos por mayor, como abarrotes y hortalizas para la elaboración de sus platillos, su razón para solicitar este préstamo la falta de efectivo para la compra de insumos,  la Sra. Nancy enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las condiciones climáticas y también la competencia  de los demás negocios de comida por lo mismo que tiene que tratar de reducir sus costos y mejorar la  sazón   de sus platillos, y va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de utensilios  y también en la ampliación de su puesto de venta para poder captar más clientes en las horas pico de almuerzo, la Sra. Nancy es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por esta oportunidad brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: The LA PAMPA entrepreneurial bank is made up of nine members, all ladies.  Nancy is the bank’s president.  She is 45 years old and has two school-aged children, ages 19 and 10.  She sells lunches from her stall in Torno.  This will be her third loan through the institution and will use the money to buy supplies such as groceries and vegetables in quantity, to make her dishes.  She is asking for this loan because she lacks cash to buy supplies.  Nancy faces challenges in her business, such as the weather and competition from other food businesses.  She needs to try to reduce her costs and improve the flavor of her dishes.  She will use the benefits to buy utensils and to set up her food stall so that she can gain more customers during the peak lunch times.  Nancy is a hardworking person, happy for this opportunity through this loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Aura Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Aura Lidia es originaria de san Rafael del sur, municipio de Managua, Nicaragua.
Es una persona luchadora, trabajadora. Trabaja para el ministerio del estado como enfermera tiene veinte y siete años de trabaja en su profesión en hospital del municipio.

Su esposo trabaja para la empresa privada  como operador de molinos crudos para la elaboración del cemento tiene quince años de laborar.

Tienen una hija mayor de edad, está casada, y tiene  una hijita de dos años.

Se le han financiados varios créditos los cuales lo ha invertido en hacerle mejora a su casa tienen una casa muy bonita que han construido con mucho esfuerzo  y con los financiamiento que les ha brindado ceprodel junto con kiva,

 son personas que se siente agradecido por el  apoyo que le han brindado y solo así han podido construir y hacerle todas las mejoras a su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Aura Lidia is a native of the municipality of San Rafael del Sur, in Managua, Nicaragua.

She is a determined and hardworking person. She works for the government as a nurse. She has worked in this profession for 27 years in a city hospital.

Her husband works for a private company as a mill operator, making cement. He has worked there for 15 years.

They have an adult daughter who is married and has a two-year-old daughter.

They have taken out several loans, which they have invested in house improvements. They have a very pretty house that they built with a great deal of effort and with financing provided by Ceprodel and Kiva. 

They feel grateful for the support that has been offered; only with that support have they been able to build and improve their home.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials like stone, sand, and cement.

loans.name: Maryuri Yissell

texts.es: La señora Maryuri es una joven mujer emprendedora, de profesión maestra  de educación secundaria de un instituto de la zona donde vive, además tiene un negocio en su casa como es la venta de Ropa de diferentes estilos y talla, es casada con 3 pequeños hijos a los que le está brindando el apoyo necesario para su desarrollo, actualmente tiene la necesidad de incrementar su inventario por las fechas de oportunidad de negocios, por tal razón se acerco a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento y lograr el objetivo  planteado, ya que lo utilizaría en la compra de pañales de niño, mamelucos, blusas de mujer, chinelas de baño, pañaleras, brassieres y reloj de mujer. Ya que esta actividad son otros ingresos que le viene a mejorar sus condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en: Mrs. Maryuri is an enterprising young women. She teaches secondary school at an institute in the area where she lives, and she also has a business in her house, where she sells clothing of different styles and sizes. She is married with three young children, to whom she gives support so they can grow. Right now, she needs to increase her inventory for her business schedule, and for this reason she is asking for a loan to reach her planned objective, since she will use it for the purchase of diapers for babies, overalls, blouses, shirts for children, jeans for women, bath slippers, changing tables, underwear, bras, and watches for women. Since this activity gives her extra income, she ill be able to increase her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy diapers for babies, overalls, blouses, shirts for children, jeans for women, bath slippers, changing tables, underwear, bras, and watches for women.

loans.name: Octaviano Francisco

texts.es: El señor Octaviano  trabaja  en un centro de salud de la comunidad donde vive, se desempeña como inspector de higiene con 24 años de laborar en dicho centro de salud, es casado  con 1 hijo a los que le brinda todo el apoyo para su desarrollo,  actualmente está presentando una necesidad de mejorar la pared y techo  de su vivienda, por lo que se decidió visitar a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción como; perlin 2x4, Bloques, cemento, zinc calibre 28 y arena,  para realizar dicha obra de mejorar la pared y techo que tanto necesita y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en: Mr. Octaviano works in a health center of the community where he lives. He works as a hygiene inspector with 24 years in this health center. He is married with one child, and he is the sole source of support for the two of them. Right now, the roof of his home needs repairs, so he visited Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy construction materials such as: 2x4s, blocks, cement, zinc, and sand, in order to complete the aforementioned repairs and have a roof like he needs, and in this way improve his living conditions and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy building materials to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Sheme

texts.en: Sheme is 40 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known market areas in Montserrado county. She was unable to attend school, and she is single with three children attending school. For six years now she has been selling bread, biscuits, and soft drinks  in her community. One of the problems she faces is  small income. She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she makes  enables her to buy   food for her household; that makes her proud of her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase bread, biscuits, and soft drinks  for her business. In the near future she hopes  to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase bread, biscuits, and soft drinks  for her business

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es: La señora María, Durante 29 años se ha dedicado a brindarle salud al prójimo, ya que su profesión es auxiliar de enfermería y labora en el centro de salud donde vive, es soltera con una persona a su cargo, a quien le brinda el apoyo necesario de acuerdo a su situación económica,  actualmente está presentando una urgencia de mejorar la pared  de su vivienda, por lo que se decidió visitar ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción como; Bloques, Cemento y Arena,  para realizar dicha obra de mejorar la pared que tanto necesita y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida
texts.en: For 29 years, Mrs. Maria has worked to bring health to her neighbors, since her profession is a physician's assistant and she works in the health center where she lives. She is single with one person in her care, to whom she gives the necessary support according to his/her economic situation. Right now, she needs to repair the roof of her home, so she has visited Ceprodel to ask for a loan for the purchase of construction materials such as: blocks, cement, and sand, in order to complete the aforementioned work on her ceiling that she needs so badly, and in this way improve her living conditions and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair the roof of her house

loans.name: Zegjine

texts.en:
Here is what Zegjine said when interviewed for this loan and about the success of the previous one:  “I started small in the beginning, using only one booth, but lately I invested in other booths because my activity grew. I am very happy, and for this I wanted to thank all Kiva lenders for the previous loan and the opportunity they gave me to grow my business.”

Zegjine’s future plans include building a house and operating her activity from a store instead.

For now, she wants to invest in buying some more second-hand clothing to resell.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of used items, such as clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is 21 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi, in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past year, Halima has been working hard to manage her small clothing business in which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Halima has requested a loan of UGX 600,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more cartons of clothes to sell and will help Halima to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for her children as well as herself. Halima hopes that, in the future, she will be able to own a very big boutique in town. 

Halima is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to stock more cartons of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Zina

texts.en:
Zina lives in West Point, one of the most populated and best-known markets in Montserrado county. She is 33 years old, she did not go to school, and  she is married with three children ages 12,16, and 19 who are in school and live at home.

For the past five years she has been operating a shop in her community where she sells  slippers and bread. She received a small amount from her husband  to start this business, and she  learned this way of trading from her mother. She likes her business because she makes a lot of profit. She is  requesting a loan to purchase slippers and bread to expand her  business. Her  plan is to educate  her children.

loans.use: to purchase slippers and bread to expand her  business

loans.name: Firangiz

texts.en:
Firangiz is 49 years old, married and has three children, a 11-year-old, a 4-year-old son and a 2-year-old  daughter. Her son goes to school. Her son wants to become a firefighter. 

Firangiz has been an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fuzuli city. Now she lives in the Fuzuli region, which is close to the occupied border. This is Firangiz's second loan from Kiva. She is very thankful to Komak and Kiva for her first loan. She started her business 9 years ago as a clothes-selling business. Now she needs a 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) loan to  buy clothes for women and resell them in her shop. 

Firangiz wants to use the money from her new business to help her family. In the future, she wants to have her own store, not rent a store as she does now. This will be more profitable for her business. Firangiz is thankful to Komak and Kiva for supporting her again.

loans.use: to buy clothes for women for resale

loans.name: Janet's Group

texts.en:
Janet's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Janet is 20 years old and lives in the town of Bombo in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past two years, Janet has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells soap, sugar, milk and bread. 

To help expand her business, Janet has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential goods like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale, and will help Janet to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Janet hopes that in the future she will be able to build rental houses. 

Janet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more essential goods like milk, bread, sugar and soap for resale

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu is a 25-year-old woman who lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado county. She did not attend school. She is single and has a four-year-old child who is in school, and lives with her at home.

For the past eight years she has been selling spoons, bowls, and plates in the local market. Sometimes the buying is slow, but most of the time she realizes profit, and she use it to sustain her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more spoons, bowls, and plates to resell at her business. She hopes to build a house, in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more spoons, bowls, and plates for her business

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
This is Vivian, a 31-year-old woman who lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado county. She did not attend school. She is married and has three children between 6 and 15 years old. All of her children are living home and attending school.

For the past 10 years she has been selling soft drinks. Sometimes it is difficult, but most of the time she realizes profit, and she uses it to sustain her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks to resell at her business. She hopes to build a house, in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks to resell at her business

loans.name: Jose Gilberto

texts.es:
José,  tiene un negocio de reparación de refrigeradora, lavadora, aire acondicionado. El habita con su compañera de vida y no tiene familiares en el extranjero.
El aprendió el oficio porque trabajo como empleado de cierto luego, después se independizo desde hace 10 años  y a partir  de ese momento atiende su negocio con horarios de 8:00 am - 5:00 pm o dependiendo de la demanda. El préstamo le permitirá comprar aparato eléctrico de soldadura y otros más. 
La inversión le ayudara a incrementar la demanda de sus clientes ya que contara con herramientas de primera necesidad en el trabajo. Su objetivo es comprar su casa, colocar el taller y trabajar con dinero propio.
texts.en:
José has his own business where he repairs refrigerators, dishwashers, and air conditioning. He lives with his common-law wife and has no family abroad.

He learned his trade because he worked as an employee for a time, then decided to become independent 10 years ago. Since that time, he tends to his business from 8:00am-5:00pm, or depending upon demand. The loan will allow him to purchase a soldering iron and other electronic apparatuses.

The investment will help him to increase the demand of his clients since he depends upon necessary tools for his work. His objective is to buy his own house, build a workshop and work with his own money.

loans.use: To buy a soldering iron and other things to help his appliance repair business.

loans.name: Jose Mercedes

texts.es: La señora jose es una mujer preocupada por la salud de los demás, por eso por vocación escogió la especialidad de licenciatura en enfermería, la cual la ejerce en un centro de salud de la localidad donde habita, con 28 años de ejercer dicha profesión, es soltera con un hijo a su cargo, el que le brinda todo el apoyo necesario para su desarrollo, actualmente está presentando una necesidad de mejorar el techo y piso de su vivienda, por lo que se decidió visitar a ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción como; Zinc, Perlin, Cerámica, Cemento Bonds y Mano de Obra, para realizar dicha obra la que tanto necesita y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones y nivel de vida.
texts.en: Mrs. Jose is a woman who is worried about the health of those around her, and that is why she was called to get a degree in nursing, which she practices in a health center in the area where she lives. She has 28 years of working in this profession. She is single with one child under her care, to whom she brings everything he needs to grow up. Right now, she needs to improve the ceiling of her house, so she decided to visit Ceprodel in order to ask for a loan for construction materials such as: Zinc, Perlin, Ceramics, Cement Bonds, and manual labor, in order to complete the work and everything that is necessary. This way, she will improve her living conditions and increase her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials and labor to help improve the roof of her house.

loans.name: Jose Balbino

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la agricultura. El vive con sus padres y no tiene familiares en el extranjero; el negocio lo aprendió en su familia y lo realiza todos los días de 7:00 am a 4:00 pm desde hace cuatro años. El préstamo que requiere le permitirá en invertir en la preparación de dos manzanas de tierra para luego cultivar. 
La compra de este le ayudara para poder realizar el cultivo y tener mejores utilidades en el futuro. Su sueño es crecer en la agricultura y poder tener mejores ingresos para aportar a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is a farmer and lives with his parents.  He does not have any relatives outside the country.  He learned this business from his family and works daily from 7:00 am to 4:00 pm and has done so for four years.  This loan will help him invest in the preparation of two plots of land so he can later farm.

This will help him plant a crop so that he can better help his family in the future.  His dream is to grow in farming and be able to have a better income with which to support his family.

loans.use: to prepare two plots of land.

loans.name: Gary Yuri

texts.es: El señor Gary Yuri tiene 22 años, es soltero, no tiene conviviente y tampoco hijos ni dependientes, termino el colegio y estaba estudiando en un instituto, iba en el primer año pero no logro terminarlo por falta de recursos económicos, vivió con sus padres, los cuales decidieron quitarle la ayuda económica para que su hijo fuese mas independiente, además de que no tuvieron la suficiente solvencia económica para colaborarle con sus estudios. Actualmente alquilo una pieza junto a su hermano. El solicitante tiene 6 años de experiencia en el servicio de mecánica, actualmente trabaja como ayudante de mecánica de motocicletas en un Taller y trabaja de lunes a sábado de 8:00 am a 12:00 pm  y de 2:00 pm a 6:00 pm, el tambien sabe hacer construcciones y se esta construyendo unos cuartos para vivir. El credito que solicita actualmente es para la compra de teja para el techado de unas habitaciones que construye en un pequeño terreno para vivir.
texts.en:
Gary Yuri, age 22, is single.  He is not in a relationship, and he has no children or dependents.  He finished high school, and he was studying at an institute.  He was in his first year, but he did not manage to finish due to lack of financial resources.

He lived with his parents, but they decided to stop helping him financially so that their son would be more independent.  Also, they were not financially solvent enough to help with his education.

He now rents a floor together with his brother.  He has six years of experience as a mechanic.  He now works as an assistant motorcycle mechanic at a repair shop.  He works Mondays through Saturdays from 8:00 a.m until 12:00 p.m. and from 2:00 p.m until 6:00 p.m.

He also knows how to build, and he is building some rooms in which to live.  The loan that he is now requesting is to buy tile for the roof of some rooms that he is building on a small piece of land where he will live.

loans.use: to buy roofing tile.

loans.name: Yawah

texts.en:
Yawah is 49 years old and lives in Margibi County, Liberia. She is married with five children between the ages of ten and 33, two of whom live on their own and the others attend school. 

For the past twenty-five years Yawah has sold oil, pepper, salt, onions, batteries and others items from a table in her community’s market. She set up her business with money given to her by her husband and learned to sell from her mother. She enjoys selling because she makes an income and is popular in the marketplace. 

Yawah is requesting an 18,000 LRD loan from BRAC Liberia to buy more goods to sell from her table. Her ambition is to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell from her table.

loans.name: Marthaline

texts.en:
Marthaline is 20 years old. She and her fiancee live at Congo Town in Montserrado County which has the largest free port and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. Her fiancee is a driver and they have a one-year-old child at home. 

Since 2009, she has been selling plantains, bananas, and oranges in her community market. Sometimes she has fewer customers, but most of the time she makes a lot of money. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more plantains, bananas, and oranges, for her business. In the future, she plans to send her child to school until he  finishes college.

loans.use: to purchase more plantains, bananas, and oranges for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 20 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Rose has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells fresh food. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh food such as cassava, sweet potatoes, and fresh vegetables to sell, and will help Rose to generate greater profits and buy her children new clothes and bed sheets for her home. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to build rental houses. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh food such as cassava, sweet potatoes, and fresh vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sawo

texts.en:
Sawo lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado county. She is 35 years old, single and has three children. Her children are between 6 and 15 years old. They are in school, and all of them live at home. Sawo's fiancee is a businessman.

For the past three years Sawo has been selling charcoal in her community. She got money from her oldest sister to start this business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal to resell at her business. She wishes to buy land and build her house, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to resell at her business

loans.name: Sababu Group

texts.en:
These are small-scale business people from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They have come to Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person in the group in order to enable them to expand their respective businesses. With a loan of SLL 500,000 each, they will be able to add more stocks into their businesses, make more sales, and more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by sending their children to school, and to feed and clothe them. 

Marian (pictured in the middle) is the featured leader of this group. She was born in eastern Sierra Leone, 33 years ago. She is married and has four children. Her husband is an artisan diamond miner and her children are attending primary schools. 

Marian sells market-food, such as palm-oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, and pepper. With her share of the loan, Marian will expand her business by buying palm-oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, etc. in large quantities, to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, etc. in large quantities, to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
This loan will help Francisco purchase inventory and an air conditioner to regulate the temperature of his warehouse for his imported foods business.

Francisco, originally from Cuba, moved to Miami in August 2012. Several months later, he had already begun his own business. By November 2012, Francisco had rented a small office space for his business, Pilot’s Exports Spain Corp, a company that imports wines, olive oils, and other fine foods from Europe. Francisco purchases the food products directly from Spain, Italy and Portugal and then sells them to local food distributors throughout the U.S. 

Francisco is looking to expand his business and needs a loan to purchase an air conditioner for his warehouse which will allow him to purchase larger orders from Europe in order to manage more client contracts.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and an air conditioner for his storage warehouse.

loans.name: Quadondoya Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Quadondoya” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 400,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Yei  is the featured leader of this group. Yei is 46 years old, and she is married with 4 children. Her husband is a diamond miner, and 3 of her children are attending primary school and 1 is in college.  Yei sells food at a market – palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, fish, tomatoes, etc. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy palm oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, fish, tomatoes, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, fish, tomatoes, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy 70 laying hens and feed

loans.name: Gabina Julia

texts.es: La señora Gabina tiene 35 años, trabajo de muy joven para poder estudiar, pece a los esfuerzos no pudo concluir sus estudios, trabajo con sus padres en el comercio de ropa, se caso a corta edad, tiene cuatro hijos. La señora Gabina junto a su esposo trabajaron por muchos años para poder obtener parte de su patrimonio, actualmente su esposo trabaja como albañil, y doña gabina vende ropa nueva  y discos DVD. Actualmente la señora Gabina usara el credito para poder comprar un lote urbano para poder construir su vivienda, de esta manera podra mejorar su calidad de vida brindandoles a sus hijos en un futuro una vivienda mas comoda.
texts.en:
Sra. Gabina is 35 years old. She worked when she was very young in order to be able to study. Despite her efforts, however, she was not able to finish her education. She worked with her parents selling clothing. She married at a young age and has four children.

Sra.  Gabina, along with her husband, worked for many years in order to acquire family assets. Currently her husband works in construction and she sells new clothing and DVD discs. She will use the loan to purchase a city lot to build a home on.  This way she can improve her quality of life, giving her children a better home in the future.

loans.use: to buy a city lot to build a home on

loans.name: Musu

texts.en: Musu is 40 years old and lives in the West Point community, which is a populated area in Montserrado County. She is living together with her spouse and children. She has three children, who are ages 7 to 13 years and attending school. Musu, herself, is not educated, but she sells provisions and cosmetics, a business which she manages well. She has sold these goods for the past five years without encountering any problem. Her mother assisted with some funds, which she used to start her business. She is asking for a loan to purchase more cosmetics, toothpaste, body cream, grease,etc  for her business, in order to have some sustainable future plan.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics, toothpaste, body cream, grease,etc  for her business,

loans.name: Susannah

texts.en:
Susannah is 49 years old and lives in the West Point community which is a populous area in Montserrado County. She is a widow with two children ages 19 years and 28 years old. One of the children is going to school while the other is working. 

Susannah is not educated but operates a building materials business selling items such as door locks, catches, hinges, nails, white-wash, etc. The business has been in operation for the past 10 years without any problem. She started the business from her husband's earnings. She needs a loan to purchase materials like door locks, catches, hinges, nails, white-wash, etc.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her business like door locks, catches, hinges, nails, white-wash, etc.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
This loan will help Omar purchase necessary inventory to allow his computer distributing company to grow.

Omar began his own business, PTC Supplies Corp., a company that exports and distributes computer and printer equipment, nine years ago in his native country of Puerto Rico. After moving to Doral City, Florida in 2010, Omar decided to continue his business in the U.S. Omar currently sells to Miami-Dade elementary schools and local individuals, and he continues to sell wholesale in Latin America, maintaining clients throughout Puerto Rico and Venezuela. 

The entrepreneur hopes to gain more clients in the U.S. and is looking to expand his business. Omar needs a loan to purchase additional PC and printer equipment in order to better serve his local clients and to attract more customers across the U.S.

loans.use: to purchase computer and printer equipment to expand his inventory.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.en: Sadia is a 40-year-old married woman with three children between the ages of 4 and 19, who are in school. They all live in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado County which is good at producing fish for the Liberian local market. Sadia has been selling palm oil and charcoal in the local market for the past five and a half years. She uses a pickup truck to get her goods from the bush (village). She faces problems during the rainy season accessing the village. She is requesting a loan to increase her inventory (palm oil and charcoal) before the rainy season. Her dream is to build a house for her children and further boost her business because it has gained her independence.

loans.use: to increase her inventory (palm oil and charcoal) before the rainy season.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado County. She is 36 years old. She is married and has two children ages 6 and 12 years old, one of whom lives at home and attends school. For 6 years, she has been running a shop where she sells cold water, soft drinks, bread, tea, fry eggs, etc. One of the problems that she faces is the rainy season because she doesn’t have a good shop.  She enjoys the interactions with her customers. The profit that she makes and having food in her home makes her proud of her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cold water, soft drinks, bread, tea, fry eggs, etc., for her business. Her dream is to have a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more cold water, soft drinks, bread, tea, fry eggs, etc., for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plantains, yuca, and yams.

loans.name: Carlos Osmin

texts.es:
Carlos,  solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de invertir más capital en la agricultura. Este le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas para llevar acabo el cultivo.
El crédito anterior le permitió incrementar su cosecha y con ello tener más ingresos para ayudar a su familia a tener una mejor calidad de vida. Las condiciones económicas han mejorado en gran medida y las circunstancias familiares se mantienen igual.
texts.en: Carlos is requesting a new loan due to the necessity of investing more capital in agriculture. This will allow him to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pest-control substances and insecticides to carry out the cultivation. The previous loan allowed him to increase his harvest and with it to have more income to help his family to have a better quality of life. The economic conditions improved in large measure and the family circumstances have remained the same.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pest-control substances and insecticides to carry out the cultivation.

loans.name: Comfort's Group

texts.en:
The group is made up of three members who have been accessing loans from ID-Ghana since 2009. They are Comfort, Gladys and Matilda. They live in Dansoman. Comfort is a seamstress, Gladys sells provisions, while Matilda sells “pito” (a drink made from fermented millet or sorghum).

ID Ghana has been of great service to them, since they have been able to grow their small businesses through the credit scheme. 

Matilda is 37 years old and married to Emmanuel, a 42-year-old hardware seller. They have a child. She has seven years experience. She works six days a week (Monday to Saturday). She is constantly working to improve on her business capital. 

This is Matilda’s ninth loan with ID-Ghana. She is requesting an amount of GHS 2,400 to buy more materials, so she can sew and sell to her customers in the community.

The entire group needs a total amount of GHS 3,600 for business expansion and to meet customers’ demand.

loans.use: to buy more materials so she can sew and sell to customers.

loans.name: Join Hand Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Join Hand” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request for a loan of 500,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Hawa is the featured leader of this group. Hawa is 27 years old, and she is married with 1 child. Her husband is a diamond miner, and her child is attending primary school. Hawa sells food at a market - rice, palm oil, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc., and has been doing this type of business for 3 years now. She has requested this loan in order to buy rice, palm oil, margi, salt, pepper, etc., in larger quantities to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil, margi, salt, pepper, etc., in larger quantities to add to her current stock

loans.name: Cony Group

texts.en:
Comfort, Victoria and Theresah make up this group. They reside in the Dansoman. They sell maize, ladies tops and panties. They have been together from 2012 to date and are still doing very well.

Comfort is a 35-year-old maize seller. She has been with ID Ghana for the past year, and she is doing very well. She has been in this business activity for 5 years now. She works from Monday to Saturday. 

This is her 3rd loan, and she needed GHS 700 to buy more goods to sell to her customers. She is grateful to ID Ghana. 

Comfort, Victoria and Theresah need a total amount of GHS 2,400 to buy more items to sell to their customers in the Dansoman community.

loans.use: To buy more maize to sell to customers

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie lives in West Point, Montserrado County, which is noted for being the most commercial city in Liberia. She is 35 years old, single, and has a 12-year-old child who is in school and lives at home. 

For the past three years she has been selling rice, palm oil, soap, salt, Vita, etc. in the local market on a table. One of the problems she faces is having only a small working capital.  She enjoys the profit she makes  every day, having  money for her expenses makes her proud of her business. Annie is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, palm oil, soap, salt, Vita, etc. for her business. Her dream is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, soap, salt, Vita, etc. for her business

loans.name: Faith In Action Group

texts.en:
In the photo are the members of the “Faith In Action” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. Together, they are requesting a loan of 2,500,000 SLL. With this loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more profit and, consequently, improve on their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Bondu.  Bondu is age 42; she was born in Kono district, eastern Sierra Leone. She is married to a diamond miner, and the couple has five children, three of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. Bondu has been a businesswoman for 13 years. She sells rice, palm-oil, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, and the like. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy the same items, on a large scale, to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy rice, margi, salt, pepper, etc., in bulk, to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en:
Bendu lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known market areas in Montserrado county. Bendu is 27 years old. She stopped her education at second grade. She is married with three children, aged between 6 and 12,  who live at home and attend school. 

For two years, she has been selling charcoal in her community. One of the problems she faces is low income. She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she makes enables her to buy food for her home and makes her proud of her business.

Bendu is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal for her business. In the near future, she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Lovise

texts.en: Lovise live in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known market areas in Montserrado county. She is 41 years old, and she has 5 children between 16 and 26 years old who are in school and live at home. For the past four years, she has been selling rice, pepper, palm oil, and others items on a table. One of the problems that she faces is the rainy season.  She enjoys the interactions with her customers and the profit that she makes. Keeping busy makes her proud of her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, palm oil, and others items for her business. She plans to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, palm oil, and others items for her business

loans.name: Delmiro Antonio

texts.es:
Delmiro, de 24 años de edad es un joven trabajador a quien le ha tocado rebuscarse la vida a fin de conseguir el sustento para él y su familia. Con dos hijos menores de edad, por los cuales vela a fin de garantizarle una mejor calidad de vida, Delmiro trabaja  diariamente comercializando recipientes plásticos, actividad que aprendió gracias a su padrastro que laboraba como vendedor ambulante. 
Hoy ha logrado montar su propio negocio con sacrificio y mucha disciplina. Su mayor deseo es incrementar su capacidad de venta y ampliar su portafolio de productos para generar mejores ingresos, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra se mercancía.
Asegura que la educación de sus hijos es su mayor prioridad por lo cual trata de esforzarse para garantizarles mejores oportunidades de vida.
texts.en:
24-year old Delmiro is a hardworking young man whose lot in life it is to support himself and his family. With two young children to care for and provide a better standard of living for, Delmiro works every day selling plastic containers, a job he learned from his stepfather who used to work as a street vendor.

Nowadays after much sacrifice and discipline he has succeeded in opening his own business. His greatest wish is to grow his inventory and increase sales so that he can earn more money. For this reason he is seeking a loan to buy more merchandise.

Delmiro explains that the education of his children is his greatest priority so he works hard in an effort to guarantee them better opportunities in life.

loans.use: Buy plastic containers

loans.name: Satta

texts.en:
Satta is 37 years old and lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well known markets in Montserrado County. She is married and has four children, ages 2, 12, 16, and 19. All of them are in school and live at home.

For the past two years, Satta has been selling rice by the cup in her community. She has a lot of customers and makes more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice by the bag for her business.

Satta hopes to improve her business and send her children to a quality college.

loans.use: to purchase more rice by the bag for her business.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie lives in West Point, one of the most populous and well-known market areas in Montserrado county. She is 35 years old, single, with a 12-year-old child that lives at home and is in school.

For two years she has been selling rice, oil, sardines and other items in her community. Too little income is the problem she faces now.  She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she generates every day. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, sardines and other items for her business. Her dream is to have a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, sardines and other items for her business

loans.name: Fanah

texts.en:
Fanah lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known markets in Montserrado county. She is 40 years old and has seven children between the ages of 8 and 25 years old. For the past three years she has been running a cook shop (restaurant) in the local market. One of the problems she faces is that the prices of ingredients are too high. She enjoys the interaction with her customers and the profit she makes daily. Having  money for her expanses makes her proud of her business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more chicken, rice, oil, spare ribs, pig feet and chicken feet, and other meats to use in her restaurant. Her dream is to become a big businesswoman and to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken, rice, oil, spare ribs, pig feet and chicken feet, and other meats, to use at her food business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil, margi, salt, pepper, etc., in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Princess

texts.en: Princess lives in West Point, one of the most populated and well-known market areas in Montserrado county, with her 8-month-old child. She is a junior high student. For the past 3 years, she has been selling bread in her community. She enjoys her business because she makes more profit every day because she has more customers. She started this business with money given to her by mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more flour, sugar, butter, and oil for her business. She plans to build a house and send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase more flour, sugar, butter, and oil for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cloth/clothes, belts, caps, etc., in larger quantities to add to his current stock

loans.name: Wilberto

texts.es:
Wilberto, se dedica a la realización de viajes y venta de ladrillo de obra. Él está casado tiene 46 años, su esposa tiene 40 años de edad y tiene dos hijos los cuales tienen edades de 8 y 10 años, ellos estudian.  Wilberto, lo lleva acabo desde hace 10 años y lo realiza de lunes a sábado. 
El préstamo que requiere lo invertirá en la compra de repuestos de carro, anillos,  entre otros y pago de mano de obra. Esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar las condiciones del vehículo y así seguir trabajando. 
Su objetivo es fortalecer más el negocio y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Wilberto transports and sells bricks. He is 46 years old and is married. His wife is 40 years old and they have two children, 8 and 10 years old, who go to school. Wilberto has been working for 10 years and works from Monday to Saturday. He will use the loan to purchase car parts and other car accessories as well as to pay for labor. The loan will help him get his vehicle into better shape so that he can continue to work. His goal is to improve his business so he can offer his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy car parts and other car accessories, as well as to pay for labor
